title: Office Manager
description:
*Are you passionate about working for a woman owned local business? Are you excited about helping to grow and expand a sustainable landscaping business? Are you interested in helping improve the community you live in? We are looking for an enthusiastic, hard-working, team-oriented individual who loves working with a passionate team of horticulturalists.

*Who You Are

*A self-starter who is organized, efficient and fun and jumps at the opportunity for more responsibility. You are a person who loves to work closely with a company owner and wants to be part of a growing company.

*Who we are

*Hawthorn Landscape Design is made up of a dynamic team of horticulturalists with a passion for creating beautiful and sustainable landscapes. We are a woman owned local Squamish business and have a particular love of ecological design.

*We are committed to helping improve the planet through environmentally sustainable gardening practices. We love being outside and getting our hands in the dirt. We do everything from garden maintenance, installations of plants, shrubs and trees as well planting native plants in beautiful forested and riparian environments.

*We believe in supporting sustainable communities and doing our part to mitigate the impacts of climate change on our natural environment. We do this by volunteering our time to help design and plant pollinator friendly gardens in partnership with community members. We also volunteer with conservation and plant restoration non-profits by helping plant native plants in wild areas.

*We provide a fun and cohesive working environment and provide mentorship and opportunities for professional growth.

*When you join Hawthorn Landscape Design you will help to strengthen sustainable communities one landscape at a time. When you join our family, you help promote a local business and strengthen our client and community relationships.

*What will help you succeed:

-Highschool Diploma

-Post secondary education an asset

-Knowledge of Mac products is essential – Macbook, i phones, i cloud storage, etc.

-Knowledge of Excel is essential

-Knowledge of Quickbooks online is an asset (eagerness to learn is essential!)

-Social media literacy—Facebook, instagram

-Strong organizational skills

- BC Driver’s License

-Effective communication skills (both verbal and written) *Ability to work under pressure and tight deadlines *Time management skills * Excellent observation skills and a strong attention to detail Good analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to work both independently with little supervision, and as part of a team You are detail oriented and like multi-tasking Ability to work both independently with little supervision and as part of a team

*A positive attitude and a sense of humour is essential.

What we will give you:

· A great team environment *Mentorship and support for you to achieve your goals and build on your strengths *Competitive wages * Room to grow at the company – this position could lead to full time operations manager position

What You Will Do as an Office Administrator

· You will support the owner to achieve your team's targets and maintain the safety, quality, and production standards of Hawthorn Landscape Design

· As with all members of Hawthorn Landscape Design, you will strive to improve yourself, your teammates, and the company always.

· This role is designed to be an active hands-on role with the company president.

· The goal is for the candidate to understand the day-to-day operations of Hawthorn Landscape Design and help the company respond to customers, manage operations and improve systems already in place.

· The role will be part time in the office and an option to work part time in the field—that may vary depending on the needs in both the field and the office.

· The role is a year- round role with the busiest times from March 1st to December 15th.

· The goal is for the job to fun, engaging and challenging.

What are your tasks:

· In charge of company communications including contacting new customers, suppliers and responding to customer concerns.

· *overseeing and organizing owner’s schedule by priority * managing and updating social media accounts* updating and adding content to company website.

· Troubleshooting day-to-day operations and assisting the owner with tasks such as expediting equipment and materials, arranging repairs of company equipment *addressing computer issues, cell phone and other technology challenges* arranging repair of computers, cell phones and other technology* yelling at the printer when needed* organizing and filing

· Using Quickbooks online, data entry of expenses and invoicing

· Assisting and coordinating with the landscape supervisor regarding equipment maintenance issues, management of Vehicles and trailers

· Helping to create an operations and training manual for office manager role and put in systems to help the office run smoothly

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent, Seasonal
Part-time hours: 20-40 per week

Salary: $20.00-$30.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Day shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Brackendale, BC V0N1H0: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Application question(s):

  • Do you Live in Squamish? If not, when will you be in Squamish?
  • How many years of administrative assistant experience do you have?
  • Are you proficient with Apple products: Mac, Iphone, Icloud, etc?
  • Are you proficient with any Accounting software like Quickbooks?

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • BC Driving Licence (preferred)

title: Horticulturist / Gardener
description:
GROW Program Verified Employer


Summary:

The Horticulturalist is responsible for assisting with the designing and building of seasonal floral arrangements. With sound horticulture experience, the Horticulturalist will interpret and build landscape designs, enhance existing designs, and collaborate effectively with their team to execute work efficiently and to the highest standards.

Job Characteristics:

  • Passion and pride in your work
  • Read and interpret landscape design plans
  • Design seasonal floral design and assist in the planting and maintenance
  • Complete work safely at all times and always use proper PPE
  • Accurately complete required documentation on time
  • Communicate professionally and clearly with co-workers, management, and clients
  • Apply horticulture best practices in all tasks
  • Be flexible and improvise in a dynamic environment
  • Operate company vehicles, equipment and hand tools
  • Work both independently and in a team setting effectively
  • Handle high pressure situations and demonstrate strong time management skills

Qualifications:

  • 3+ years of experience in a landscaping position preferred
  • Strong knowledge in landscaping tools, equipment, plant care and identification, specifically trees, shrubs, and perennials
  • Experience in a team leader position and capable of coaching a small crew
  • Training and/or education in Horticulture
  • Valid 'G' driver's license, experience with operating a cube van and 1 tonne dump truck
  • Skid Steer/Bobcat operation experience is an asset
Show more

title: Senior Maintenance Team Member
company: Garden City Tree and Landscaping LTD
description:
Garden City Tree and Landscape

Position available – Senior Maintenance Team Members.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $23.00 – 28.00 per hour

Company Cell phone,

onsite free parking,

health benefits,

training and tuition provided for pertinent training,

bonuses,

new and state of the art equipment,

peer support,

advancement with training.

Whether you are a passionate gardener, love the smell of freshly cut grass or just like making things look great, our Maintenance Team does it all. We care for and improve the gardens of discerning clients all over Greater Victoria and the Westshore. Our relationship with our clients is important and we care for their gardens as if they were our own. Our attention to detail and communication with our clients is what makes us Victoria’s premier Maintenance Team.

If you can take ownership of the properties you work on and care about their health and appearance as our clients do then you have found the job for you.

Successful applicants should have the following:

  • Plant ID and knowledge of common garden plants as well as knowledge of cultural conditions, pruning techniques are preferred.
  • Field related certification (Certified horticulturalist, Pesticide Applicator Ticket, ISA, ITA, Red Seal Horticulturalist, etc.)
  • You must be able to use small gas tools safely and confidently (mowers, trimmers, shears, backpack blower, etc.)
  • Knowledge of automatic irrigation systems timing and troubleshooting an asset.
  • Ability to come in on time, perform a high quality of work and ensure there is an excellent client experience.
  • Class 5 with clean driver abstract
  • Trailer experience an asset.

This is a physical position and applicants should be physically capable of 7.5 hours of work per day . Scope of work is gardening and landscape maintenance (lawn care, weeding, pruning of plant material, garden clean up, etc.) but not limited to, and may also include work with our hardscape and construction crews, irrigation, arbor, & nursery work as well. You must be able to keep a good pace while maintaining a high quality of work. An interest in all areas of the landscaping business would be an asset.

Our people are why we are different from our competition. From the teams in the field to the office team and Owners, we all care about the quality of work we create each day, the environment we work in and how we treat each other. A commitment that makes us unique.

Our company core values:

  • Respect for individuals,
  • Peer support
  • Safe work environment
  • Quality work
  • Client experience
  • Personal accountability

We are committed to making a difference for anyone that chooses to become a Garden City employee.

Your Wage is reviewed annually to ensure our quality people are properly compensated.

Additionally:

Company benefits available after a 90 day probationary period. These excellent, industry leading benefits, are detailed below:

  • Extended health care
  • Vision care
  • On-site parking
  • Company events & social hours
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Education reimbursement

Additional benefits include:

Education support and reimbursement, peer support, great work environment, positive culture, company events and social hours (subject to covid 19 restrictions).

If you care about how you are treated, if you are looking for room to grow, if you want a company that truly cares about its people, please contact us and let us personally show you what makes us different.

Garden City Tree & Landscape ltd is a unique landscape company and unlike any other in Greater Victoria. Let me explain.

  • Even with the world at a standstill due to pandemic concerns, we at Garden City were busy as an essential service. Yes, we had to implement immediate changes to our normal way of doing things to protect our people and clientele (stringent cleaning and disinfecting, social distancing, one to a vehicle, etc.) but landscapes continue to grow and emergency tree situations need attention. So we provide year round employment, even under difficult conditions.
  • We work 12 months of the year, i.e. we are NOT seasonal. Our staff have families and commitments so they cannot work 9 or 10 months a year, they need full time employment. If and when our normal landscape activities are interrupted by snow, we simply change our focus to addressing our large institutional clients with their snow clearing needs.
  • Our large and centrally located works yard is zoned and licensed to allow us the ability to repurpose organic materials and overburden we collect in our day to day landscape operations, including our tree operations. We grind the organic waste and age it for resale. We separate the overburden so it can be repurposed and resold. We re-purpose 90% of what our competitors consider waste! Not only does this effort significantly reduce our environmental footprint, it also allows us to sell quality soils and mulch to our clients. It makes the landscapes we create that much better.
  • We care about our footprint,
  • We care about the product we sell to our customers.
Show more

title: Landscape Construction Labourers
description:
Position Title: Landscape Construction Apprentice

Want to live, work and play in one of Canada's premier holiday destinations? Located in Vernon, BC, the Okanagan Valley is known for its mild winters and gorgeous summers. Come join our team of Landscape construction experts and become a Journeyman Landscape Horticulturalist, a designated Red Seal Trade, and lets see where your career will take you next.

Company: Outdoor Aspects Landscaping is a growing, well established landscape construction company located in Vernon, BC serving the North Okanagan for the past 14 years. We are a design and build firm founded on strong values that delivers creative, quality landscapes for our customers to enjoy for a lifetime while giving them an awesome customer experience. Our team members take great pride in what we do. We work in an exciting, high performance culture and love bringing awesome people to our team! Check out our work at www.outdooraspects.com

Position Type: Full time seasonal (March 1st - Dec 1st)

Our promise to you:

  • You will work with a crew leader and production manager in a team environment creating beautiful outdoor spaces from pools to plants and everything in between.
  • You will be mentored in all required hard and softscape install techniques using the latest equipment in a safe and efficient manner for a quality finished product.
  • You will be given clear goals and regularly given feedback on your performance so you can be busy with creating quality products and 5 star service while building your new career.
  • You will arrive at work each day with a smile and be amazed at how fast the day goes by because you enjoy the work you are doing so much.

Desired Professional and Personal Qualifications:
Personal:

  • Team orientated outlook
  • A willingness and desire to learn, and follow instruction
  • A friendly and polite personality
  • Punctual
  • Reliable
  • Good communication skills
  • Able to work productively without supervision
  • Detail orientated

Professional:

  • Experience in installing hard and softscapes is desirable
  • Valid Drivers License with a clean drivers abstract
  • Must have own transportation
  • Level 1 First Aid an asset
  • Able to work overtime as required
  • Aptitude for using power tools in a safe and effective manner
  • Hard working
  • Physically fit (able to lift 80lbs consistently and for long duration's)
  • Willingness to work outside in all weather conditions.

Rewards: Red Seal Landscape Horticulturalist Journeyman apprenticeships available after completion of three months service. Family friendly environment, regular performance reviews, 4% vacation pay, overtime pay, 5 unpaid vacation days/yr besides stat holidays, medical and dental benefits package, endless opportunities for advancement. Base starting wage of $17-29/hr pending level of experience plus additional compensation of up to $10/hr added based on completed years in apprenticeship program.

Application: Kick start your future, today! If this sounds like you, check out our website (www.outdooraspects.com), email us and let us know why you think you'd be a great fit for our team!

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent, Apprenticeship

Salary: $17.00-$36.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • No weekends
  • Overtime

Experience:

  • landscaping: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Drivers License (required)

title: Landscape/Hardscape Foreman
description:
Who are We?


Trim Landscaping is a full-service landscaping company that provides commercial and large-scale high-end residential and landscaping services in Nova Scotia. We are continually growing and are looking to add a Landscape/Handscape Foreman to our team in Bedford! We have done many premier maintenance and design-build landscape projects in NS like Argyle and Spring Garden streets, Queen’s Marque and Peggy Cove’s Viewing Deck.


Who are You?


You are an experienced hardscaper, landscaper and/or horticulturalist willing to lead and train a crew. You are very comfortable running a softscape or hardscape project from start to finish with limited direction from your manager. You are experienced with basic excavation, grading/layout, gravel base installation/compaction and installation of pavers and retaining walls and/or experienced in grading and laying sod/seed, planting trees and installing a garden bed. You don’t mind a long hard day of slugging it with your crew.


More importantly, you are driven individual looking to grow and be a part of moving a business forward. You are trustworthy so that you can take on tasks and projects within your team with limited supervision. You are able to solve problems and willing to make a decision even if it’s a mistake. You are willing to work outside of your everyday tasks and responsibilities when the team needs you.


You need a valid driver’s license, to be experienced in operating equipment and at least 3 years’ of experience in landscape construction.


What will you do?


Day-to-day you will be working with a crew of 2-3 people completing a variety of projects that could include laying pavers, planting trees, building retaining walls, pouring concrete or constructing a deck throughout NS. You will work directly with a project manager to troubleshoot grading, layout, scheduling and major issues with site and customers. In the winter, your team may vary based on route with snow removal. You are the right-hand to the crew leader with whatever tasks need completion.


What will you Own?


  • Project productivity day-to-day
  • Project quality day-to-day
  • Crew safety
  • Preventative maintenance and cleanliness of your equipment
  • Training of your crew members

What do we Offer?


  • Compensation range from $24/hour to $27/hour
  • 3 weeks’ vacation
  • Company phone plan and company truck
  • Training and professional development opportunities
  • A great team and a family environment
  • Participation in bonus program
  • RRSP matching program after 6-months
  • Health & Dental Benefits after 3-months

Trim is an equal employer that is non-discriminatory. Please let us know if you require any accommodations when you apply.

Show more

title: Landscape Construction - Okanagan Valley
description:
Want to live and work in the Okanagan? Do you have years of landscape construction experience but no certification to show for it? This may be for you.

Come join our team of Landscape construction experts and become a Journeyman Landscape Horticulturalist, a designated Red Seal Trade and lets see where your career will take you next.

Company: Outdoor Aspects Landscaping is a growing, well established landscape construction company located in Vernon, BC serving the North Okanagan for the past 14 years. We are a design and build firm founded on strong values that delivers creative, quality landscapes for our customers to enjoy for a lifetime while giving them an awesome customer experience. Our team members take great pride in what we do. We work in an exciting, high performance culture and love bringing awesome people to our team! Check out our work at www.outdooraspects.com

Position Type: Full time seasonal (March 1st - Dec 1st)

Our promise to you:

  • You will work with a production manager in a team environment creating beautiful outdoor spaces from pools to plants and everything in between.
  • You will be mentored in all required hard and softscape install techniques using the latest equipment in a safe and efficient manner for a quality finished product.
  • You will be given clear goals and regularly given feedback on your performance so you can be busy with creating quality products and 5 star service while building your new career.
  • You will arrive at work each day with a smile and be amazed at how fast the day goes by because you enjoy the work you are doing so much.

Desired Professional and Personal Qualifications:
Personal:

  • Team orientated outlook
  • A willingness and desire to learn, and follow instruction
  • A friendly and polite personality
  • Punctual
  • Reliable
  • Good communication skills
  • Able to work productively without supervision
  • Detail orientated

Professional:

  • Experience in installing hard and softscapes (3 years preferred)
  • Valid Drivers License with a clean drivers abstract
  • Must have own transportation
  • Level 1 First Aid an asset
  • Able to work overtime as required
  • Aptitude for using power tools in a safe and effective manner
  • Hard working
  • Physically fit (able to lift 80lbs consistently and for long duration's)
  • Willingness to work outside in all weather conditions.

Rewards: Red Seal Landscape Horticulturalist Journeyman apprenticeships available after completion of three months service. Family friendly environment, regular performance reviews, 4% vacation pay, overtime pay, 5 unpaid vacation days/yr besides stat holidays, medical and dental benefits package, endless opportunities for advancement. Base starting wage of $22-29/hr pending level of experience plus additional compensation of up to $10/hr added based on completed years in apprenticeship program.

Application: Kick start your future, today! If this sounds like you, check out our website (www.outdooraspects.com), email us and let us know why you think you'd be a great fit for our team!

title: Gardener/Labourer
description:
Certified horticulturalist looking for a reliable and responsible gardener to join our team. Must be able to lift 50lbs and do a physically demanding job. Our small business does ongoing maintenance (lawn cutting, pruning, weeding) for our clients as well as new garden installations, planting, small paving jobs and more.

We work Monday to Friday with the occasional Saturday during peak season of spring and fall.

Experience in commercial horticulture/landscaping is preferred. Starting wage can be discussed based on experience and wage increases dependant on performance. Most hires get a raise in the first month.

We need someone reliable and punctual who is on time for work every day and able to follow direction and learn as they go. Work days start at the plaza on Esquimalt road and successful candidates must be able to arrive there by 6:45am.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $20.00-$25.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Overtime
  • Weekend availability

title: Landscape Labourer
description:
Outdoor Aspects Landscaping Ltd.

Landscape Construction Technician
Who we are:
Outdoor Aspects Landscaping is a well established landscape company located in Vernon, BC serving the North Okanagan for the past 14 years. We are a landscape design and build firm founded on strong values that delivers creative, quality landscapes for our customers to enjoy for a lifetime while giving them an awesome customer experience to boot. Our team members take great pride in what we do. Our Landscape Construction Technicians play a major role in fulfilling the company’s vision. Their role is to work as a team with there crew leader ensuring projects are completed to specifications. Our company’s long standing reputation of high quality work and outstanding customer service depends on the skill and professionalism of our entire team.

Who you are:

This role is ideal for a person with a very high level of physical strength and stamina who enjoys physical labour. Any landscape construction experience installing paving stone patios, retaining walls, softscapes, irrigation systems, pools or working other physically demanding jobs would be a major asset. To be a good fit for this role, you will need to be able to commit to year round employment doing 10hr days 5 days a week from March to December and reduced hours and holiday time over the winter months. Winter work usually entails hardscape work that can be done as the weather allows. Priority will be given to applicants who have work experience in landscape construction. This position is available immediately.

What you’ll do:

1) Planting trees, shrubs and plants, installing drip lines and fabric

2) Shoveling and hand raking of soil, gravel, mulch and sand, laying sod

3) Assist in build irrigation systems, paving stone patios, retaining walls and fiberglass pools

4) Use landscaping equipment such as tampers, power wheel barrows, and mini skidsteers

What you’ll need:

1) Prior job experience in Landscape Construction is preferred

2) High level of physical fitness & stamina (ability to lift 80lbs consistently)

3) Ability to work outdoors in a wide variety of physical conditions

4) Ability to follow verbal directions and complete tasks without supervision

5) Your own transportation and driver license

6) A friendly and polite personality

7) A strong desire to learn and grow in the Landscape Industry

What you’ll get:

1) Red Seal Landscape Horticulturalist Journeyman apprenticeships available after completion of three months service if so desired.

2) Family friendly environment

3) Regular performance reviews

4) 4% vacation pay, overtime pay, 5 unpaid vacation days/yr (March-December) besides stat holidays

5) Medical and dental benefits package

6) Opportunity for advancement

7) A base starting wage of $17-23/hr pending level of experience plus additional compensation of up to $7/hr added based on completed years in apprenticeship program.

8) Free Tanning and Workouts.

If this sounds like you, check out our website (www.outdooraspects.com), email us and let us know why you think you'd be a great fit for our team! Kick start your future, today!

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent, Apprenticeship

  • Monday to Friday

title: Horticulturalist
description:
Summary

The Supervisor contributes to the success of a store by communicating the retail objectives of their respective department to the team. This role is responsible for assisting the Department Manager in managing and leading the department in providing high quality workmanship and service that ensures customer satisfaction. He/she assists the Department Manager and the team in consistently meeting performance expectations in terms of customer experience, sales growth, retail execution, and profitability.

Responsibilities and Tasks

Customer Service

  • Encourages and maintains a culture that values an excellent customer experience through effective training, supervision, and coaching.
  • Leads by example and consistently delivers an excellent customer experience.
  • Holds team members accountable for providing an excellent customer experience and recognizes those who excel in it.
  • Works as a team with other departments to provide an excellent customer experience.
  • Suggests value-added and related products to customers to ensure they go home with all they need.
  • Closes the discussion with the customer by using a closing statement (e.g., “Is there anything else I can do for you today?” “Thank you for shopping at Canadian Tire.”).
  • Responds to and handles customer inquiries, requests, and concerns in a timely manner, over the phone and in person.
  • Handles multiple customers in an effective and efficient manner.

Operations

  • Assists the Department Manager in maintaining quality department presentation, through daily inspections and ensuring all store audit performance requirements are met in the department (e.g., number of holes, labels, top shelf storage, rain check posted for out of stock items, deadlines of seasonal changeovers, cleanliness, facing, fixtures are stored away when not in use, etc.).
  • Supervises and assists team members in daily departmental operations in order to meet established productivity goals.
  • Assists the Department Manager in following up on work and projects on the floor in order to measure progress and address issues immediately, while being visible and available for team members and customers.
  • Walks the department to understand what needs to be accomplished on a daily basis.
  • Maintains department inventory and fullness through accurate stock levels and bin caps.
  • Plays an active role in the department team by openly sharing opinions and ideas on how to improve department success, and by participating in meetings and all training as required.
  • Informs team on in-store promotions, in-store deals, and new product locations.
  • Assists with planning and managing daily/weekly departmental activities as well as seasonal changeovers, and works with the team to execute them.
  • Provides support to cashiers and customer service representatives for cash pickups, cash closing, warranties, returns, guarantees, etc.
  • Assists in the orientation and training of new employees, store opening and closing responsibilities.
  • Assists in organizing and conducting regular department team meetings.
  • Communicates and ensures compliance of all company, store, and department policies, as well as, health and safety programs and regulations.
  • Uses professional language and maintains a professional appearance (uniform, hygiene, grooming, and name tag) when interacting with others.
  • Assists the Department Manager with various projects and tasks.
  • Completes other tasks, as required.

Requirements

  • Experience in retail sales, execution, and operations.
  • Good working knowledge of department products and functions.
  • Demonstrated supervisory, leadership, and/or managerial experience, or relevant experience.
  • Ability to operate cash register is an asset.
  • Basic math and keyboarding skills.
  • Experience in a Canadian Tire store is considered an asset.

Required Skills and Abilities

Successful candidates will demonstrate the following competencies:

  • Highly approachable, customer-oriented individual who thrives on offering exceptional service to customers.
  • Strong belief in the Canadian Tire Values of honesty, integrity, and respect.
  • Effective written and oral communication skills (e.g., probing, listening, etc.) and the ability to maintain professional communication, even in challenging situations.
  • Ability to complete retail tasks according to instructions and to demonstrate responsibility for outcomes.
  • Ability to assist in leading and managing others to achieve common goals in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to motivate and coach others.
  • Ability to resolve retail and/or customer issues.
  • Ability to adapt and cope with challenging and changing situations.
  • Ability to find solutions to problems and make decisions.
  • Positive attitude, punctuality, and solid work ethic.

Potential Career Opportunities

  • Next levels: Department Manager and Store Manager.
  • Other retail, customer service and management opportunities in a large network of more than 485 Canadian Tire Stores across the country.
  • Career opportunities across the larger Canadian Tire family (Canadian Tire Petroleum, PartSource, Mark’s, FGL Sports Ltd, Canadian Tire Corporation Limited, and Canadian Tire Financial Services).

Physical Demands and Working Conditions

In compliance with the store’s Health and Safety Policies and Procedures:

  • Standing/walking for 8 hours.
  • Lifting and/or carrying of merchandise items, as required, on a regular, frequent and unassisted basis. Merchandise items may vary in weight from “light” to “heavy”.
  • Lifting and turning repeatedly throughout the shift.
  • Lifting above the shoulder, from floor to shoulder and floor to waist.
  • Walking and carrying at the same time and pushing/pulling as required.
  • Twisting, turning, reaching and working above shoulder level.
Show more

title: Landscape Designer, Sales & Project Manager
description:
Our Award Winning Landscape Firm has been offering full Landscape Design, Build, Maintenance and Supplies services in Prince Edward County and surrounding regions for 24 years. We pride ourselves on reliable customer service, quality installations, unique and client driven design processes, skilled and trained tradespeople and long standing client relationships. Our team is made up of Designers, Estimators, Operation Managers, Office Assistants, Construction Installers including Carpenters and Masons as well as Horticulturalists and Landscapers. We grow our client base and reputable services more each year and need a key person to join our company to work in our Design & Sales Department. This position is full-time, year round with medical/dental benefits, vehicle, laptop/software and schedule flexibility.

Key Responsibilities will include:

- Client meetings, communications, estimating/sales using provided software and project planning

- Landscape Design ranging from conceptual sketching to full scale master landscape and drainage/grading plans complete with construction packages and estimations/proposals

- Must be proficient in AutoCAD and/or Dynascape, SketchUP, Adobe, Microsoft Excel and Word

- Must be self motivated, client oriented, hardworking, flexible person who thrives in a fast paced environment and has knowledge of landscape building practices

- Candidate will enjoy working as part of a team, communicate well with others and have demonstrated experience project managing (Residential, Commercial and Municipal)

- Preference will be given to experienced designers with great attitudes and creative, functional portfolios

Education:

- Landscape Architecture ( Member of the OALA)

OR

- Landscape Designer (Graduated)

Desired Work Experience:

- Landscape Design and/or Construction - 5+ Years

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $50,000.00-$100,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
COVID precautions include daily screening app, masking, social distancing, enclosed private office space and santizing.

Education:

  • AEC / DEP or Skilled Trade Certificate (preferred)

title: Landscape Horticulturalist / Maintenance Foreman
description:
Hello, and thank you for taking the time to browse our ad.

Red Door Landscape Services Ltd. is looking for a highly qualified professional to fill the position of supervisor on our horticulturalist team. The ideal candidate will either have a diploma in Horticulture, or has challenged the Red Seal horticulture certification test.

We are a full service Victoria, BC based landscape company that prides itself in delivering creative, tasteful and high quality installations and maintenance services to its clients, and serve some of the most prestigious clients in Victoria.

Our current crew is professional, inclusive, confident and easy to work with. Red Door places emphasis on healthy work culture and we’re seeking like minded team members who want to build a career with a creative and energetic company focused on high quality results.

On top of being a good fit within the team and the ability to manage large sites, successful candidates should have experience in many of the following areas:

  • An eye for details, quality and design
  • Ability to manage client relations
  • Project management and budget tracking skills on large maintenance sites
  • Managing a growing maintenance portfolio
  • Horticultural knowledge for maintaining trees, shrubs, perennials, & annuals
  • Strong written and verbal communication
  • Strong time management skills

Job duties include:

  • Managing the full extent of the maintenance portfolio
  • Managing the safety, quality, & productivity of sites
  • Supervise, coordinate and schedule multiple crews of 2-3 employees
  • Operate various tools and equipment including driving a trailer, power hedge trimmer, leaf blower, lawn mowers etc.
  • Coordination with other departments (irrigation, planting, maintenance) to efficiently maintain all properties
  • Complete and submit project records on a daily basis including time and materials summary, expenses, equipment use etc.
  • Assist in the planning of planting or other maintenance projects prior to production
  • Maintain and enforce standards of cleanliness and organization in assigned company vehicles, machinery and job sites.
  • Reading, interpreting, and adapting planting plans

Our maintenance portfolio continues to expand and we are looking for a qualified individual to assist in client and crew management under the leadership of the current Accounts Manager.

Along with a resume and cover letter feel free to tell us a bit about yourself by email. Successful candidates will be contacted in kind but follow ups never hurt.

Thank you and we look forward to hearing from you.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $25.00-$28.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Company car
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Vision care
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
We encourage our staff to get vaccinated, and we follow all provincial health and safety requirements.

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Victoria, BC: reliably commute or be willing to relocate with an employer-provided relocation package (preferred)

Experience:

  • landscaping: 3 years (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • driver's license (required)
  • Diploma in Horticulture (preferred)

Are you looking to find a career you will enjoy? Do you love creating beautiful outdoor spaces? If so, this could be for you!

title: Landscaping Supervisor
description:
Are you looking for an opportunity to take the next step in your career with a well-respected company in the Landscape Maintenance business?

Premier Landscaping is looking for an ambitious, committed and experienced Landscaper to grow with us as a Partner Supervisor!

About Us
Since 1978 Premier has been creating beautiful landscapes with strategic annual maintenance programs for strata managers and residents. By understanding the needs of the industry, we have become strata specialists in the Lower Mainland and the Fraser Valley.

Your Responsibilities
As our Partner Supervisor, you have extensive Gardening/Landscaping experience, an entrepreneurial mindset and strong ambitions to grow your team and business under the Premier Landscaping brand, and as a valued member of the Premier team. In your role, you will:

  • Perform all landscaping/other site work to Premier's standards
  • Execute the project schedule by tasking the Landscapers on the crew with activities that promote learning, are appropriate to their skill level, and capitalize on their strengths
  • Monitor work being done by Landscapers on the crew to meet the quality and efficiency targets of the project. Provide feedback, coaching and performance management when required to help your team develop!
  • Report accurately and efficiently through the Aspire Mobile App
  • Submit bi-weekly invoices for payment, as agreed based on contracted amount
  • Ensure general cleanliness and maintenance of the job site
  • Adhere to and model the Premier Landscaping Code of Conduct
  • Daily reporting on any customer contact that requires Premier management attention
  • Quote and provide services, on behalf of Premier
  • Use Premier branded uniform/truck magnets when on Premier sites

Your Experience & Qualifications

  • 3-5 years' experience as a Landscape Technician, Horticulturalist or similar, working in all seasons and Commercial settings
  • At least 2 years of experience in a supervisory capacity
  • Experienced and comfortable in the use of pesticides
  • Honest and trustworthy with strong leadership and decision-making abilities
  • Strong customer focus, attention to detail, high standards of professionalism and a positive demeanour
  • Ability to lead a team by strong example and communication
  • Must be able to operate your own truck, as well as maintain and fix equipment

Considered A Bonus

  • Residential Landscape Technician (RLT) course completion considered an asset
  • Journeyman Landscape Horticulturist Red Seal considered an asset

Your Benefits

  • The ability to be your own boss and build a team
  • Premier takes care of the administration for you
  • Being employed on a contract basis allows for ‘smart work’ with the seasons
  • Bonus system based on worker and site referrals
  • On-site training, education and support
  • Company-wide free events

Does this sound like the right opportunity for you to leverage your expertise?
We want to hear from you – apply with your resume today!

Work Remotely

  • No

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent

Salary: From $60,000.00 per year

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Experience:

  • Landscaping Lead Hand: 2 years (preferred)
Show more

title: Irrigation Technician- Located in Kamloops, BC
description:
Lyons is looking to add to our team, with relocation to our main office in Kamloops, BC!

At Lyons, we focus on the client experience and our team culture! By joining Lyons, you are joining a team of talented and dedicated landscapers, horticulturalists, irrigation technicians, among many others! We offer career development and training opportunities, and most importantly, we have a team that cares for each other and strive for success!

Our Irrigation Technicians will not begin irrigation work until mid March to beginning of April but can join our snow removal team now!

Responsibilities:

  • Full residential and commercial irrigation installations
  • Irrigation blow outs and start ups
  • Irrigation system maintenance, repairs, and troubleshooting

Qualifications:

  • Minimum 2 years experience in full commercial and residential irrigation installations
  • IIABC Certified Irrigation Technician Level 1 (Level 2 would be considered an asset)
  • Knowledge of both Poly and PVC piping
  • Ability to problem solve and critical think
  • Ability to prioritize tasks
  • Ability to work efficiently and independently
  • Ability to understand and follow irrigation plans
  • Valid Class 5 driver's licence with a clear driving record
  • Strong work ethic and attention to detail
  • Positive attitude and desire to be apart of growing a company
  • Ability to use a smart phone or tablet for time tracking and reporting
  • Strong communication skills with our team and clients

Why work with the Lyons team?

  • Competitive salaries with a benefits package
  • Incentive and bonus programs
  • Growth, training, and development opportunities
  • Team Culture, we support one another to succeed!
  • Team building, appreciation, and celebratory events
  • Locally owned and operated company who gives back to the community
  • $1000 signing bonus potential! Speak with our team for more information!

We thank all applicants for their interest, however we will only be contacting those we wish to move forward with in the application process.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: Up to $30.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Store discount
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
Lyons follows all required COVID-19 protocols with the help of our detailed policy and procedure manual.

Experience:

  • commercial irrigation installation: 1 year (preferred)
  • irrigation repair: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • driver's licence with a clear record (preferred)

Work remotely:

  • No

title: Jardinier-Paysagiste-Horticulteur / Landscape Gardener-Horticulturalist
description:
Job description

Jardinier-Paysagiste-Horticulteru/ landscape Gardener-Horticulturalist
About us

Plantenance Landscape Group

Job description

English to Follow

Nous sommes à la « Recherche des MEILLEURS TALENTS »

Êtes-vous prêt pour une vraie carrière? Un emploi avec un avenir!
Ne cherchez pas plus loin!

Chez Plantenance, nous croyons que les gens exceptionnels méritent d’avoir des occasions remarquables et nous les récompensons en conséquence. En tant que membre apprécié de notre équipe, vous aurez l’occasion de faire progresser votre carrière et d’aiguiser vos talents tout en veillant sur des aménagements paysagers exceptionnels.

VOUS CROYEZ AVOIR CE QU’IL FAUT?

TALENTS ET QUALIFICATIONS:
· Avoir le désir d’apprendre, de progresser et de réussir.
· Accomplir ses tâches avec efficacité afin d’atteindre les objectifs.
· Être enthousiaste, consciencieux et minutieux.
· Être dévoué, ambitieux et très respectueux du code d’éthique.
· Capacité exceptionnelle de communication.
· Passion pour la création & l’entretien des aménagements paysagers.
· Fierté d’un travail bien fait.
· La capacité à travailler dehors dans des conditions diverses.
· Opération sécuritaire et efficace d’équipements et d’outils du métier.
· Permis de conduire de Classe 5 en règle.

FORMATION PROFESSIONNELLE RECHERCHÉE:
· D.E.C. ou D.E.P. ou certificat équivalent en horticulture / aménagements paysagers
· Au moins 1 année de formation formelle ou 2 années d’expérience professionnelle
· Certificat en secourisme.

ÉCHELLE DE SALAIRE

· $ 19.20- $ 31.00 pour les « Superstars » de l’aménagement
· Avantages PLANTENANCE = Avantages + incitatifs + bonus

Le Groupe d’aménagement paysager Plantenance est décidément une entreprise pas comme les autres. Votre intérêt et capacité de bien vous intégrer dans la culture de notre entreprise est aussi importante que vos aptitudes et votre expérience.

Si vous croyez que vos valeurs et votre passion correspondent aux nôtres, alors venez construire et soigner avec nous des aménagements paysagers impressionnants.

UNE OPPORTUNITÉ VOUS ATTEND !

** Plantenance pratique une approche de recrutement continuel afin de découvrir des "superstars" en aménagement paysager. Nous sommes toujours à la recherche de talents et nous perfectionnons et retenons les meilleurs candidats de la profession afin de continuer à réussir ensemble.
___________________________________________________________________________
We’re on a "QUEST FOR THE BEST" Talent Search

Life's too short for another dead end job? Come work where its awesome!

At Plantenance, we believe that great people deserve great opportunities and reward them accordingly. As a valued member of our team, you have the potential to grow your career and develop your talents while caring for some exceptional outdoor spaces.

DO YOU HAVE WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR?

ESSENTIAL TALENTS + QUALIFICATIONS

· The desire to learn, grow and succeed
· Efficiently accomplish tasks to meet budget objectives
· Enthusiastic + conscientious with attention to detail
· Dedicated + ambitious with a strong work ethic
· Outstanding communication
· Passionate about creating or maintaining luxury landscapes
· Extreme pride in a job well done
· Able to work outdoors in various conditions.
· Safe + efficient operation of related tools / equipment
· Valid class 5 driver’s license

PREFERRED PROFESSIONAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS:

DEC or DEP or equivalent certificate in horticulture or landscaping
Minimum 1 year formal training or 2 years professional experience
First-aid/safety certified.

SALARY RANGE

· $ 19.20 - $ 31.00 for true Landscape Superstars P L U S
· Plantenance Perks = benefits + incentives + bonuses

Plantenance Landscape Group is decidedly not your typical landscape company. Your interest and ability to fit within our company culture is as important as your skills and experience.

If you believe your values and passion mirror our own, apply today and together we'll care for some award winning landscapes for some truly awesome clients.

LET'S GET STARTED TODAY!

** Plantenance practices an "Always Be Hiring" approach to discover our latest landscape superstars. We continuously seek-out talent and retain the absolute best in the profession to continue to succeed and prosper together.

Salary: $19.20-$31.00 per hour

Plantenance Landscape Group provided the following inclusive hiring information:

Job Types: Full-time, Freelance, Permanent

Salary: $19.20-$31.00 per hour

COVID-19 considerations:
- remote interview process
- personal protective equipment provided or required
- Social distancing guidelines in place
- Virtual meetings

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent, Freelance, Seasonal

Salary: $19.20-$31.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Discounted or free food
  • On-site parking
  • RRSP match

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Pointe-Claire, QC: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Application question(s):

  • What encouraged you to apply to join our team?

Experience:

  • Horticulture: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Class 5 Licence (required)

title: Seasonal Cannabis Field Technician
description:
Must be 19+ to apply.

Looking for motivated, passionate individuals to join our field crew for the 2022 season!

Job description

Do you have a passion for plants? Do you know the difference between a pistil and a stamen? Do you enjoy working with like-minded individuals who love to work with a collaborative, hard working, fast-paced team? We are looking for experienced gardeners, farm hands, horticulturalists and growers who would like to spend their season working on our 25-acre cannabis farm, situated near Cedar on Vancouver Island. Any plant knowledge is welcomed – we do not require cannabis-specific knowledge at this time, as we are very willing to teach interested individuals.

The main responsibilities will include, but are not limited to: field prep, transplanting, general plant care, pruning, irrigation setup, IPM scouting, paperwork, sanitation of cultivation equipment and tools, harvest. Please note that this is a physically demanding position. We are looking for individuals who are easy going but hard working, flexible but also able to follow our strict SOPs and guidelines as set out by Health Canada.

Please feel free to outline in a cover letter your skills and what you would be looking to bring to our fantastic team. As we are a farm, there are many moving parts of our operation, and we welcome anyone who can bring a variety of skills to the crew.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Working outdoors on a cannabis farm, in all weather (hot, humid, rain, cold)
  • Assist with all aspects of field work in an efficient and effective manner
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs at a time
  • Punctuality is a must
  • Report to Team Leads and follow daily instruction
  • Having a safety-conscious mind
  • Ability to follow strict Standard Operating Procedures and Health Canada Regulations
  • Bringing a positive, can-do attitude to work – after all, we do grow cannabis for a living!

Qualifications:

- 1 year of gardening/farm/horticulture experience (preferred)

- Experience working on a farm or equivalent (preferred)

- Knowledge of IPM practices, irrigation and fertigation systems considered an asset

- Knowledge of farm equipment, including tractors and engines, considered an asset

Job Type: Seasonal

Salary: $18.00-$20.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Weekend availability
Show more

title: Landscape Technician
description:
Who you are:

This role is ideal for a person with a very high level of physical strength and stamina who enjoys physical labour. Any landscape construction experience installing paving stone patios, retaining walls, softscapes, irrigation systems, pools or working other physically demanding jobs would be a major asset. To be a good fit for this role, you will need to be able to commit to year round employment doing 10hr days 5 days a week from March to December and reduced hours and holiday time over the winter months. Winter work usually entails hardscape work that can be done as the weather allows. Priority will be given to applicants who have work experience in landscape construction. This position is available immediately.

Who we are:

Outdoor Aspects Landscaping is a well established landscape company located in Vernon, BC serving the North Okanagan for the past 15 years. We are a landscape design and build firm founded on strong values that delivers creative, quality landscapes for our customers to enjoy for a lifetime while giving them an awesome customer experience to boot. Our team members take great pride in what we do. Our Landscape Construction Technicians play a major role in fulfilling the company’s vision. Their role is to work as a team with there crew leader ensuring projects are completed to specifications. Our company’s long standing reputation of high quality work and outstanding customer service depends on the skill and professionalism of our entire team.

What you’ll do:

1) Planting trees, shrubs and plants, installing drip lines and fabric

2) Shoveling and hand raking of soil, gravel, mulch and sand, laying sod

3) Assist in build irrigation systems, paving stone patios, retaining walls and fiberglass pools

4) Use landscaping equipment such as tampers, power wheel barrows, and mini skidsteers

What you’ll need:

1) Prior job experience in Landscape Construction is preferred

2) High level of physical fitness & stamina (ability to lift 80lbs consistently)

3) Ability to work outdoors in a wide variety of physical conditions

4) Ability to follow verbal directions and complete tasks without supervision

5) Your own transportation and driver license

6) A friendly and polite personality

7) A strong desire to learn and grow in the Landscape Industry

What you’ll get:

1) Red Seal Landscape Horticulturalist Journeyman apprenticeships available after completion of three months service if so desired.

2) Family friendly environment

3) Regular performance reviews

4) 4% vacation pay, overtime pay, 5 unpaid vacation days/yr (March-December) besides stat holidays

5) Medical and dental benefits package

6) Opportunity for advancement

7) A base starting wage of $18-25/hr pending level of experience plus additional compensation of up to $7/hr added based on completed years in apprenticeship program.

If this sounds like you, check out our website (www.outdooraspects.com), email us and let us know why you think you'd be a great fit for our team! Kick start your future, today!

title: Seasonal Greenkeeper
company: River Bend Golf and Recreation Area
description:
Job Description – Seasonal Greenkeeper
*
Function/Purpose:

Responsible for the operation of a select number, or all, of the maintenance/construction equipment as well as the performance of physical labour and other job related tasks as assigned. Responsible for the performance of physical labour as assigned to him or her in the area of maintenance, construction, repair and semi-skilled grounds work or related tasks.

Responsible to:

Under direct supervision of the Superintendent, Assistant Superintendent(s), and/or Course Foreman. From time to time may be directed by Equipment Technician or the Horticulturalist.

Duties, Responsibilities and Authorities (portion OR all of the following):
*

  • Operating all types of golf course and park equipment (pedestrian mowers, utility vehicles, riding mowers, top dresser, aerator, bunker rake, tractors, etc.).
  • Operating strimmers, flymowers, push mowers, chainsaw, and other power and hand tools.

*

  • Maintaining bunkers as required.
  • Perform course set-up and property tidy (tee markers, hole changes, and garbage collection, etc.)
  • Fertilizing greens, tees, and/or approaches as required.
  • Laying sod, raking and levelling dirt areas for seeding.
  • Assisting in construction of new tees, greens, fairways, retaining walls and any other landscaping construction.
  • Pruning trees, shrubs and maintaining flower beds.
  • Perform, as assigned, any additional duties which may be required by the Superintendent, Assistant Superintendent(s), or Course Foreman from time to time.
  • Report all golf and facility related problems and incidents to the Superintendent.
  • Adhere to all River Bend Golf & Recreation Society policies and procedures.

*
*
Minimum Entry Requirements:

  • Excellent physical health and able to perform any labour work requested.
  • A valid Alberta Class 5 Driver's Permit and the ability to operate equipment proficiently when reasonable training and practice time is provided.

*

  • Abilities, Skills and Special Requirements:
  • Ability to operate motorized equipment, tractors, etc.
  • Ability to operate power and hand tools, (Ex. strimmers, chainsaw, push mowers, etc.)
  • Ability to follow oral and written directions.
  • A general knowledge of golf maintenance or landscaping, or the ability to learn.
  • Good communicative skills -- both oral and written.
  • Must be able to safely operate all golf course equipment and related accessories.
  • Willingness to work weekends and shifts.
  • Ability to work in an effective and positive manner with general public and other employees.
  • Must provide own transportation to and from River Bend.

*

Work remotely

  • No

Job Types: Full-time, Temporary
Contract length: 6 months

Salary: From $15.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Discounted or free food
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
sanitizing of equipment occurs daily

Expected start date: 2022-05-24

title: Landscaper/Labourer
description:
Are you ready to join the pack?

Lobo Landscape Ltd sets the bar for Horticulturalists and Stone Technicians in London Ontario and we are looking to hire skilled labourers to join our team. Candidates must be willing to work in any weather Spring, Summer and Fall and have a clean driver’s licence (preferably with Heavy Truck driving experience.) Previous landscaping and hardscaping experience is an asset, but we're looking for a fantastic attitude above all else.

Who we are:

Lobo Landscape has been completing design builds for over 30 years for both residential and commercial operations, engaging in all aspects of the industry. We are a well established small business who specialize in stone work, steps, patios, walkways, fire pits, landscaping, planting, putting greens, carpentry, and water features.

What we want:

We are looking for candidates who are seeking excellence and expect excellence in return.

We want individuals who thrive in this field and are passionate about working as part of a fun and hard-working team.

Someone who is willing to work no matter rain or shine.

Someone who has an attention to detail and can maintain our high standards with clients and staff.

A positive attitude and an eagerness to progress.

A clean G Drivers license in a must. (Heavy Truck experience preferable)

Physically fit (ability to lift 30 kg (65lbs))

Strong communication skills.

A good team player.

A willingness to learn both machinery equipment and basic gardening principles.

Reliable time keeping and work ethic.

What we offer:

Pay is subject to to experience (paid biweekly).

PPE is provided (excluding steel toe cap footwear)

Uniform shirts.

Ongoing high levels of training.

Do you want to be part of the Lobo pack? Apply now!

Due to the high volume of applicants, only successful applicants will be selected for an interview.

Note due to the yards location, public transport does not offer any close or accessible means.

Sanitizing stations, screening questions, proof of vaccines.

title: Horticulturalist/Plant Lover!
description:
Recognized by Landscape Ontario with Awards of Excellence for our work, Landscapes By Lucin is seeking a Horticulturalist/Plant Lover! Together with our Production Manager and President, the successful candidate will work to ensure quality growth in our rapidly expanding planting division.

You are a detail-oriented person with the ability to:

  • Identify the plant material we supply and install, recommend substitutions, provide soil identification and provide existing plant identification.
  • Organize and work alongside planting crews as needed, co-ordinate deliveries, tag plant material, plant placements on-site and inspect quality of work.
  • Help with the training of staff as needed ensuring proper planting techniques and best horticultural practices.
  • Deal directly with clients on a sales basis.

We're looking for someone with a strong business sense who can set goals, review progress, and consistently keep "all the balls in the air".

If you're nodding, we'd like to meet you! Remuneration, benefits and incentives will be discussed upon interview.

Why join Landscapes By Lucin?

We truly believe that when it comes to delivering exceptional work and outstanding customer service, our employees are our partners, and the reason for our success. We're rooted in growing our business – and providing opportunities for professional growth and development over the long term.

title: Horticulturalist
description:
Horticulturalist

Competition Number

#5-68

Job Code

5120

Posting Date

April 25, 2022

Closing Date

May 10, 2022

Job Status

Permanent Full-Time

Responsibilities:
  • Work individually or within a team to perform all aspects of horticulture related work including plant propagation, growing, bed design, layout and installation, maintenance of landscape plantings, pruning, and plant health care.
  • Work individually or within a team to plan and organize materials, supplies, and equipment to carry out daily job assignments.
  • Identify and provide recommendations to Supervisor for all supplementary work required to maintain horticulture beds and support community gardens on City lands.
  • Independently monitor and assess landscaping conditions and identify maintenance based on understanding of levels of service, plant health care and season planting plans.
  • Operate various types of vehicles and equipment (e.g. tractors, loaders, small power equipment, etc.) as required.
  • Participate in the winter job pool process which results in winter job duties assignment (e.g. snow plowing, hand shoveling, etc.).
  • perform required inspections of Community Gardens
  • Perform other duties as assigned.


Requirements:
  • Must possess a Diploma in Horticulture or an approved equivalent certificate in a related field.
  • Must have Ministry of Environment Landscape or Structural Exterminator License.
  • Must have proven knowledge and experience of methods and techniques in commercial horticulture relating to greenhouse operations, pruning, fertilizing, cultivation, soil elements, design, layout and planting, interpreting blueprints, and landscape construction.
  • Must have a minimum 2000 hours (1 year) of related experience within the field of Commercial Horticulture or equivalent as determined by the Corporation.
  • Must have valid MTO driver's license class "DZ" in GOOD standing (No more than 3 Demerit Points, no more than 1 conviction in previous 36 months, no driving related Canada Criminal Code convictions in previous 36 months, no CVOR ‘at fault’ convictions in previous 24 months and no ignition interlock restrictions)
  • Must be reliable with good attitude and employment record.
  • Must be willing to successfully complete a medical examination if required.
  • Must successfully complete required progression criteria as it relates to this job title.
  • Must possess Grade 12 education.
  • Must have demonstrated communication skills with a customer service focus and the ability to keep accurate written records.
  • Must be able to perform a variety of duties including manual labour.
  • Must be flexible to work varying shifts, weekends, overtime, and winter call outs as required.

In accordance with the City of Kitchener’s Mandatory Verification of COVID-19 Vaccination Policy, new City of Kitchener employees (or employees rehired after a break in service of more than 3 months) are required to be fully vaccinated as a condition of hire, subject to accommodations required in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code.

We are committed to diversity and inclusion, and thank all applicants in advance.
Accommodations are available during all stages of the recruitment process in accordance with the Human Rights Code.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however only candidates selected for further consideration will be contacted

Please note that as per Human Resources Policy HUM-HIR-110, "Employment of Relatives of Staff Members and Elected Officials":
"The immediate relatives of staff of the Human Resources Division, all Directors, General Managers, or the Chief Administrative Officer and Elected Officials shall not be employed by the City in any capacity.
The immediate relatives of all other Management personnel shall not be employed where such employment would be:
1. within the same Department in the case of permanent full-time, temporary full-time and part-time classifications.
2. within the same Division in the case of students."

Department

Infrastructure Services

Division

Parks and Cemeteries

Union Affiliation

CUPE 68

Number of Positions

2

Hours of Work

Monday - Friday 7:00 am - 3:00 pm.

Location

Facility

Kitchener Operations Facility

City

Kitchener

Compensation

Salary Range

$28.78 - $30.47

Grade/Band

6 (under review)

title: Horticulturalist or Horticulture Assistant
description:
Who are you'
You’re an active adventurer with a green thumb. You’re a passionate plant lover. You’re a positive motivator with a tenacious spark. Working outdoors excites you and you desire to learn and grow with other like-minded individuals in a green industry career. At the end of the day, when you’re hands are marred with dirt and there are grass stains on your pants, you step back and are proud of what you’ve accomplished because you know it will be enjoyed by many.

Who are we'
We’re a very tight knit group of professionals looking to add to our growing team. Belleview Landscapes was established to serve both people and the environment. We have the ambition to directly impact the love and wellbeing of the people in our communities and create meaningful change in the spaces in which we interact. That is what cultivates our passion for building community resilience and supporting sustainably focused initiatives. We imagine, design , create, and maintain the environments in which we live, work and play. And we can’t wait to meet you, our new Property Maintenance Specialist.

What we offer:
  • $20-$30/hr
  • paid training and personal/professional development
  • potential for bonuses and commissions
  • benefits (currently in development)
  • kick grass and have fun doing it
What you already have:
  • G class license
  • a degree of certification in a realted field
  • 3+ years of experience in a related field
  • a interest in sustainability
  • a focus on integrity
  • a desire to be curious

The types of projects we get into are…
  • softscaping enhancements
  • light landscape construction
  • landscape and garden design
  • annuals and seasonal plant displays
  • tree care
  • landscape maintenance
…and everything we do is sustainably focused!!! EVERYTHING

DM us or contact through email - explore@belleviewlandscapes.com - to learn more…

title: Horticulturalist/Gardener
description:
Job Type: Full-time (Seasonal)

Earthbound Kids is a seasonal summer camp and tree farm with two locations serving children and youth ages 4-16. Our programs include summer camps, leadership programs, and outdoor education programs. The programs we offer have a strong emphasis on growing trees, sustainable farming and environmental education.

We are looking for mature and caring Horticulturalists/Gardeners for both our Stouffville and Schomberg Ontario locations, for the 2022 season. Gardeners will manage the planting, care and upkeep of our teaching gardens, orchards and nursery. The position involves, working alongside our Arborist & Outdoor Education team to create safe, informative and meaningful learning experiences for school groups and campers.
The ideal candidate enjoys working outdoors, in a farm environment and sharing their passion and knowledge with people of all ages

Job Responsibilities:

  • Maintenance of gardens weeding, pruning and dead heading, mulching and amending existing gardens
  • Planting trees, shrubs, perennials and annuals
  • Maintenance of existing gardens including, weeding, mulching, pruning, natural pest control
  • Maintenance of compost system
  • Grass cutting and general maintenance around the garden areas to create a tidy, aesthetically pleasing site
  • Assist in the maintenance of on-site trails
  • Diagnose problems, damage and disease in plants & trees
  • Assisting with the preparation and loading of trees and materials onto the trucks for delivery to other locations

Qualifications and Requirements:

  • Training and/or education in Horticulture, Urban Forestry, Arboriculture or related discipline
  • Valid Ontario Class “G” Driver’s Licence
  • Skid Steer/mini-excavator operation experience
  • 2+ years of experience in a landscaping position preferred
  • Strong knowledge of plant care and plant identification

To Apply: Please submit a resume to: Carol Norton, Earthbound Kids indicating the job title in the subject line

Please note that although we thank all applicants, only those considered for an interview will be contacted.

Earthbound Kids values the diversity of people. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodation will be provided, on request, to support candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time
Part-time hours: 37-44 per week

Salary: $18.00-$26.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Overtime
  • Weekend availability

Experience:

  • Gardeners: 2 years (preferred)

Expected start date: 2022-05-02

title: Greenhouse Nursery Worker
description:
Position Title: Greenhouse Nursery Worker

Organization: Jplant

Location: Napanee, Ontario

Contract Duration: 6 to 8 months (April - November)

Hours: 40 hours per week

Wage: $16.00 per hour

Jplant is a propagation nursery located just north of the 401 in Greater Napanee, Ontario. We propagate bamboo, ornamental grasses, and flowering shrubs for sale to the public and the commercial market. We make all sales online and ship to clients thus there is no public customer relations on site.

We are currently seeking several motivated, hard-working individuals with an interest in horticulture and plant propagation. This is an opportunity to work with a master horticulturalist, learn best practices in plant propagation and greenhouse management, as well as learn about over 1000 different plant species and varieties. We are a growing company and are interested in investing in hard working individuals for future employment.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

Job Description

  • Work with a small nursery team
  • Propagate plants by cuttings or division
  • Transplanting seedlings and rooted cuttings
  • Pruning
  • Weeding
  • Prepare orders for shipping

Qualifications

  • Education and/or experience in horticulture or a related field is an asset
  • Quick learner and able to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Responsible and able to work independently
  • Organized and detail oriented
  • Good communication skills and ability to work in a small team
  • Able to complete tasks efficiently and on schedule
  • Able to understand and follow directions exactly as given
  • Health and Safety mindfulness
  • Valid G class drivers license (or able to arrange reliable transportation to the nursery)
  • Fitness: A variety of tasks require workers to stay in one position over long periods of time: standing, kneeling, sitting. Able to safely lift up to 40lbs on occasion.
  • Ability to work outdoors in hot sun, rain, and cold fall weather.

Job Type: Full-time
Contract length: 6-8 months

Salary: $16.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Expected start date: 2022-04-04

title: Horticulturalist (Summer Contract)
description:
Hours: 8:30 am to 5:00 pm, Monday-Friday (Flexible) 37.5 hours per week

The Canadian Film Centre (CFC) is a charitable cultural organization that drives the future of Canadian storytelling. Our intensive, hands-on programs in film, television, and entertainment technologies empower, shape and advance opportunities for Canadian creators and entrepreneurs working in screen-based industries. Learn more at cfccreates.com.

You will be a crucial member of the team maintaining beautiful Windfields estate. Windfields is a designated heritage property. It features eight buildings, two woodlots, hedgerows and gardens, and more than 200 specimen trees.

The Horticulturalist is responsible for employing best practices in the care of the heritage gardens and the lawns. This position offers a diverse range of hands-on responsibilities.

Responsibilities:

  • Inspect flowering shrubs, garden plants and turf for insects, disease and overall health and take appropriate action
  • Plan, plant and maintain planters
  • Transplant perennials and install soft landscaping
  • Recommend replacement or removal of plants
  • Weeding, mulching and raking
  • Apply fertilizer as required
  • Maintain the water feature
  • Maintain the gardening tools and equipment
  • Update the CFC’s Landscape and Garden Report, and online landscape maps, documenting the gardens (photos, text and drawings)
  • Assist the Arborists, as required, with major projects; and
  • Perform other related duties as assigned.

Requirements:

  • Enrolled in or completed a Horticultural, Landscape Architecture, Environmental
  • Design or related program at the post-secondary level
  • Ability to meet the physical requirements of the job including: bending, lifting, utilizing hand tools and working in various weather conditions
  • Plant poison licence is an asset.

Interested candidates should submit a cover letter and resume to by May 20, 2022, and indicate “Horticulturalist” in the subject line.

CFC employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of being eligible for the recruitment process. Proof of COVID-19 vaccination will be required. If you are not able to obtain COVID-19 vaccination for a reason related to a protected ground of discrimination under applicable human rights legislation, you can request accommodation from the CFC.

The CFC is committed to equity, diversity and inclusion and encourages interested applicants from all backgrounds to apply. The CFC is also an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require accommodation during any stage of the recruitment process, please notify Human Resources

We thank all interested applicants; however, only qualified candidates will be contacted. No telephone calls, please.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $16.00-$22.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Application deadline: 2022-05-27
Expected start date: 2022-06-06

title: Horticulturalist
description:
GROW Program Verified Employer


Hiring: Experienced Horticulturalist

Company: Flourish Garden Services Inc.
Location: Queen St. West with clients throughout Toronto, Ontario

Flourish Garden Services has an opening for an experienced horticulturalist to join our 2022 team, full- or part-time. We’d love to hear from you, if you are:

  • Passionate about gardening
  • Physically strong, fit and energetic
  • Friendly, positive and a team player
  • Eager to learn and contribute

Who Are We'

We provide expert sustainable garden care, planting installation and enhancements services to our Toronto clients. We have been doing so since 2007. We believe healthy beautiful natural spaces are vital to the well-being of our urban community. Plus, we get to work outside, in nature, every day.

We are a conscientious boutique company where each member’s input is valued. We look out for each other, strive to do our best every day, and focus on making a difference – garden by garden.

Who Are You'

You love plants, enjoy working hard outdoors and being part of a team that shares and cares. You take pride in your work and completing your tasks to the highest standards. You want to learn and seek professional growth in the landscape industry and in the company.

The Work:

  • Gardening: weeding, pruning, tending plants, trimming, topdressing, raking, organic lawn care
  • Assist with planting installations, seasonal arrangements
  • Follow company policies and all Health & Safety policies
  • Use and maintain standard small landscape power tools & equipment
  • Drive and/or organize, clean vans
  • Complete daily time & materials tracking, job reporting.

What We Offer:

  • On-the-job training, learning opportunities & career growth
  • Performance-based bonuses
  • Paid Stat Holidays (*starting July 1st, pro-rated for part-time)
  • Benefits
  • Uniforms, PPE & COVID-19 prevention protocols
  • $18-25 hourly wage (based on experience & skills)
  • Work/life balance

Extra consideration for wage level based on having:

  • Full G driver’s license (clean abstract), experience driving in Toronto
  • Previous ornamental gardening experience

Term: 2022 Season April - December

Hours: typically between 7 a.m. to 5 p.m., M-F (full- or part-time)

Location: We are located in the Queen St. West area and travel to our clients throughout Toronto
