title: Office Manager
description:
*Are you passionate about working for a woman owned local business? Are you excited about helping to grow and expand a sustainable landscaping business? Are you interested in helping improve the community you live in? We are looking for an enthusiastic, hard-working, team-oriented individual who loves working with a passionate team of horticulturalists.

*Who You Are

*A self-starter who is organized, efficient and fun and jumps at the opportunity for more responsibility. You are a person who loves to work closely with a company owner and wants to be part of a growing company.

*Who we are

*Hawthorn Landscape Design is made up of a dynamic team of horticulturalists with a passion for creating beautiful and sustainable landscapes. We are a woman owned local Squamish business and have a particular love of ecological design.

*We are committed to helping improve the planet through environmentally sustainable gardening practices. We love being outside and getting our hands in the dirt. We do everything from garden maintenance, installations of plants, shrubs and trees as well planting native plants in beautiful forested and riparian environments.

*We believe in supporting sustainable communities and doing our part to mitigate the impacts of climate change on our natural environment. We do this by volunteering our time to help design and plant pollinator friendly gardens in partnership with community members. We also volunteer with conservation and plant restoration non-profits by helping plant native plants in wild areas.

*We provide a fun and cohesive working environment and provide mentorship and opportunities for professional growth.

*When you join Hawthorn Landscape Design you will help to strengthen sustainable communities one landscape at a time. When you join our family, you help promote a local business and strengthen our client and community relationships.

*What will help you succeed:

-Highschool Diploma

-Post secondary education an asset

-Knowledge of Mac products is essential – Macbook, i phones, i cloud storage, etc.

-Knowledge of Excel is essential

-Knowledge of Quickbooks online is an asset (eagerness to learn is essential!)

-Social media literacy—Facebook, instagram

-Strong organizational skills

- BC Driver’s License

-Effective communication skills (both verbal and written) *Ability to work under pressure and tight deadlines *Time management skills * Excellent observation skills and a strong attention to detail Good analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to work both independently with little supervision, and as part of a team You are detail oriented and like multi-tasking Ability to work both independently with little supervision and as part of a team

*A positive attitude and a sense of humour is essential.

What we will give you:

· A great team environment *Mentorship and support for you to achieve your goals and build on your strengths *Competitive wages * Room to grow at the company – this position could lead to full time operations manager position

What You Will Do as an Office Administrator

· You will support the owner to achieve your team's targets and maintain the safety, quality, and production standards of Hawthorn Landscape Design

· As with all members of Hawthorn Landscape Design, you will strive to improve yourself, your teammates, and the company always.

· This role is designed to be an active hands-on role with the company president.

· The goal is for the candidate to understand the day-to-day operations of Hawthorn Landscape Design and help the company respond to customers, manage operations and improve systems already in place.

· The role will be part time in the office and an option to work part time in the field—that may vary depending on the needs in both the field and the office.

· The role is a year- round role with the busiest times from March 1st to December 15th.

· The goal is for the job to fun, engaging and challenging.

What are your tasks:

· In charge of company communications including contacting new customers, suppliers and responding to customer concerns.

· *overseeing and organizing owner’s schedule by priority * managing and updating social media accounts* updating and adding content to company website.

· Troubleshooting day-to-day operations and assisting the owner with tasks such as expediting equipment and materials, arranging repairs of company equipment *addressing computer issues, cell phone and other technology challenges* arranging repair of computers, cell phones and other technology* yelling at the printer when needed* organizing and filing

· Using Quickbooks online, data entry of expenses and invoicing

· Assisting and coordinating with the landscape supervisor regarding equipment maintenance issues, management of Vehicles and trailers

· Helping to create an operations and training manual for office manager role and put in systems to help the office run smoothly

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent, Seasonal
Part-time hours: 20-40 per week

Salary: $20.00-$30.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care

title: Horticulturist / Gardener
description:
GROW Program Verified Employer


Summary:

The Horticulturalist is responsible for assisting with the designing and building of seasonal floral arrangements. With sound horticulture experience, the Horticulturalist will interpret and build landscape designs, enhance existing designs, and collaborate effectively with their team to execute work efficiently and to the highest standards.

Job Characteristics:

  • Passion and pride in your work
  • Read and interpret landscape design plans
  • Design seasonal floral design and assist in the planting and maintenance
  • Complete work safely at all times and always use proper PPE
  • Accurately complete required documentation on time
  • Communicate professionally and clearly with co-workers, management, and clients
  • Apply horticulture best practices in all tasks
  • Be flexible and improvise in a dynamic environment
  • Operate company vehicles, equipment and hand tools
  • Work both independently and in a team setting effectively
  • Handle high pressure situations and demonstrate strong time management skills

Qualifications:

  • 3+ years of experience in a landscaping position preferred
  • Strong knowledge in landscaping tools, equipment, plant care and identification, specifically trees, shrubs, and perennials
  • Experience in a team leader position and capable of coaching a small crew
  • Training and/or education in Horticulture
  • Valid 'G' driver's license, experience with operating a cube van and 1 tonne dump truck
  • Skid Steer/Bobcat operation experience is an asset
Show more

title: Senior Maintenance Team Member
company: Garden City Tree and Landscaping LTD
description:
Garden City Tree and Landscape

Position available – Senior Maintenance Team Members.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $23.00 – 28.00 per hour

Company Cell phone,

onsite free parking,

health benefits,

training and tuition provided for pertinent training,

bonuses,

new and state of the art equipment,

peer support,

advancement with training.

Whether you are a passionate gardener, love the smell of freshly cut grass or just like making things look great, our Maintenance Team does it all. We care for and improve the gardens of discerning clients all over Greater Victoria and the Westshore. Our relationship with our clients is important and we care for their gardens as if they were our own. Our attention to detail and communication with our clients is what makes us Victoria’s premier Maintenance Team.

If you can take ownership of the properties you work on and care about their health and appearance as our clients do then you have found the job for you.

Successful applicants should have the following:

  • Plant ID and knowledge of common garden plants as well as knowledge of cultural conditions, pruning techniques are preferred.
  • Field related certification (Certified horticulturalist, Pesticide Applicator Ticket, ISA, ITA, Red Seal Horticulturalist, etc.)
  • You must be able to use small gas tools safely and confidently (mowers, trimmers, shears, backpack blower, etc.)
  • Knowledge of automatic irrigation systems timing and troubleshooting an asset.
  • Ability to come in on time, perform a high quality of work and ensure there is an excellent client experience.
  • Class 5 with clean driver abstract
  • Trailer experience an asset.

This is a physical position and applicants should be physically capable of 7.5 hours of work per day . Scope of work is gardening and landscape maintenance (lawn care, weeding, pruning of plant material, garden clean up, etc.) but not limited to, and may also include work with our hardscape and construction crews, irrigation, arbor, & nursery work as well. You must be able to keep a good pace while maintaining a high quality of work. An interest in all areas of the landscaping business would be an asset.

Our people are why we are different from our competition. From the teams in the field to the office team and Owners, we all care about the quality of work we create each day, the environment we work in and how we treat each other. A commitment that makes us unique.

Our company core values:

  • Respect for individuals,
  • Peer support
  • Safe work environment
  • Quality work
  • Client experience
  • Personal accountability

We are committed to making a difference for anyone that chooses to become a Garden City employee.

Your Wage is reviewed annually to ensure our quality people are properly compensated.

Additionally:

Company benefits available after a 90 day probationary period. These excellent, industry leading benefits, are detailed below:

  • Extended health care
  • Vision care
  • On-site parking
  • Company events & social hours
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Education reimbursement

Additional benefits include:

Education support and reimbursement, peer support, great work environment, positive culture, company events and social hours (subject to covid 19 restrictions).

If you care about how you are treated, if you are looking for room to grow, if you want a company that truly cares about its people, please contact us and let us personally show you what makes us different.

Garden City Tree & Landscape ltd is a unique landscape company and unlike any other in Greater Victoria. Let me explain.

  • Even with the world at a standstill due to pandemic concerns, we at Garden City were busy as an essential service. Yes, we had to implement immediate changes to our normal way of doing things to protect our people and clientele (stringent cleaning and disinfecting, social distancing, one to a vehicle, etc.) but landscapes continue to grow and emergency tree situations need attention. So we provide year round employment, even under difficult conditions.
  • We work 12 months of the year, i.e. we are NOT seasonal. Our staff have families and commitments so they cannot work 9 or 10 months a year, they need full time employment. If and when our normal landscape activities are interrupted by snow, we simply change our focus to addressing our large institutional clients with their snow clearing needs.
  • Our large and centrally located works yard is zoned and licensed to allow us the ability to repurpose organic materials and overburden we collect in our day to day landscape operations, including our tree operations. We grind the organic waste and age it for resale. We separate the overburden so it can be repurposed and resold. We re-purpose 90% of what our competitors consider waste! Not only does this effort significantly reduce our environmental footprint, it also allows us to sell quality soils and mulch to our clients. It makes the landscapes we create that much better.
  • We care about our footprint,
  • We care about the product we sell to our customers.
Show more

title: Landscape Construction Labourers
description:
Position Title: Landscape Construction Apprentice

Want to live, work and play in one of Canada's premier holiday destinations? Located in Vernon, BC, the Okanagan Valley is known for its mild winters and gorgeous summers. Come join our team of Landscape construction experts and become a Journeyman Landscape Horticulturalist, a designated Red Seal Trade, and lets see where your career will take you next.

Company: Outdoor Aspects Landscaping is a growing, well established landscape construction company located in Vernon, BC serving the North Okanagan for the past 14 years. We are a design and build firm founded on strong values that delivers creative, quality landscapes for our customers to enjoy for a lifetime while giving them an awesome customer experience. Our team members take great pride in what we do. We work in an exciting, high performance culture and love bringing awesome people to our team! Check out our work at www.outdooraspects.com

Position Type: Full time seasonal (March 1st - Dec 1st)

Our promise to you:

  • You will work with a crew leader and production manager in a team environment creating beautiful outdoor spaces from pools to plants and everything in between.
  • You will be mentored in all required hard and softscape install techniques using the latest equipment in a safe and efficient manner for a quality finished product.
  • You will be given clear goals and regularly given feedback on your performance so you can be busy with creating quality products and 5 star service while building your new career.
  • You will arrive at work each day with a smile and be amazed at how fast the day goes by because you enjoy the work you are doing so much.

Desired Professional and Personal Qualifications:
Personal:

  • Team orientated outlook
  • A willingness and desire to learn, and follow instruction
  • A friendly and polite personality
  • Punctual
  • Reliable
  • Good communication skills
  • Able to work productively without supervision
  • Detail orientated

Professional:

  • Experience in installing hard and softscapes is desirable
  • Valid Drivers License with a clean drivers abstract
  • Must have own transportation
  • Level 1 First Aid an asset
  • Able to work overtime as required
  • Aptitude for using power tools in a safe and effective manner
  • Hard working
  • Physically fit (able to lift 80lbs consistently and for long duration's)
  • Willingness to work outside in all weather conditions.

Rewards: Red Seal Landscape Horticulturalist Journeyman apprenticeships available after completion of three months service. Family friendly environment, regular performance reviews, 4% vacation pay, overtime pay, 5 unpaid vacation days/yr besides stat holidays, medical and dental benefits package, endless opportunities for advancement. Base starting wage of $17-29/hr pending level of experience plus additional compensation of up to $10/hr added based on completed years in apprenticeship program.

Application: Kick start your future, today! If this sounds like you, check out our website (www.outdooraspects.com), email us and let us know why you think you'd be a great fit for our team!

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent, Apprenticeship

Salary: $17.00-$36.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • No weekends
  • Overtime

Experience:

  • landscaping: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Drivers License (required)

title: Landscape/Hardscape Foreman
description:
Who are We?


Trim Landscaping is a full-service landscaping company that provides commercial and large-scale high-end residential and landscaping services in Nova Scotia. We are continually growing and are looking to add a Landscape/Handscape Foreman to our team in Bedford! We have done many premier maintenance and design-build landscape projects in NS like Argyle and Spring Garden streets, Queen’s Marque and Peggy Cove’s Viewing Deck.


Who are You?


You are an experienced hardscaper, landscaper and/or horticulturalist willing to lead and train a crew. You are very comfortable running a softscape or hardscape project from start to finish with limited direction from your manager. You are experienced with basic excavation, grading/layout, gravel base installation/compaction and installation of pavers and retaining walls and/or experienced in grading and laying sod/seed, planting trees and installing a garden bed. You don’t mind a long hard day of slugging it with your crew.


More importantly, you are driven individual looking to grow and be a part of moving a business forward. You are trustworthy so that you can take on tasks and projects within your team with limited supervision. You are able to solve problems and willing to make a decision even if it’s a mistake. You are willing to work outside of your everyday tasks and responsibilities when the team needs you.


You need a valid driver’s license, to be experienced in operating equipment and at least 3 years’ of experience in landscape construction.


What will you do?


Day-to-day you will be working with a crew of 2-3 people completing a variety of projects that could include laying pavers, planting trees, building retaining walls, pouring concrete or constructing a deck throughout NS. You will work directly with a project manager to troubleshoot grading, layout, scheduling and major issues with site and customers. In the winter, your team may vary based on route with snow removal. You are the right-hand to the crew leader with whatever tasks need completion.


What will you Own?


  • Project productivity day-to-day
  • Project quality day-to-day
  • Crew safety
  • Preventative maintenance and cleanliness of your equipment
  • Training of your crew members

What do we Offer?


  • Compensation range from $24/hour to $27/hour
  • 3 weeks’ vacation
  • Company phone plan and company truck
  • Training and professional development opportunities
  • A great team and a family environment
  • Participation in bonus program
  • RRSP matching program after 6-months
  • Health & Dental Benefits after 3-months

Trim is an equal employer that is non-discriminatory. Please let us know if you require any accommodations when you apply.

Show more

Position Type: Full time seasonal (March 1st - Dec 1st)

Our promise to you:

  • You will work with a production manager in a team environment creating beautiful outdoor spaces from pools to plants and everything in between.
  • You will be mentored in all required hard and softscape install techniques using the latest equipment in a safe and efficient manner for a quality finished product.
  • You will be given clear goals and regularly given feedback on your performance so you can be busy with creating quality products and 5 star service while building your new career.
  • You will arrive at work each day with a smile and be amazed at how fast the day goes by because you enjoy the work you are doing so much.

Desired Professional and Personal Qualifications:
Personal:

  • Team orientated outlook
  • A willingness and desire to learn, and follow instruction
  • A friendly and polite personality
  • Punctual
  • Reliable
  • Good communication skills
  • Able to work productively without supervision
  • Detail orientated

Professional:

  • Experience in installing hard and softscapes (3 years preferred)
  • Valid Drivers License with a clean drivers abstract
  • Must have own transportation
  • Level 1 First Aid an asset
  • Able to work overtime as required
  • Aptitude for using power tools in a safe and effective manner
  • Hard working
  • Physically fit (able to lift 80lbs consistently and for long duration's)
  • Willingness to work outside in all weather conditions.

Rewards: Red Seal Landscape Horticulturalist Journeyman apprenticeships available after completion of three months service. Family friendly environment, regular performance reviews, 4% vacation pay, overtime pay, 5 unpaid vacation days/yr besides stat holidays, medical and dental benefits package, endless opportunities for advancement. Base starting wage of $22-29/hr pending level of experience plus additional compensation of up to $10/hr added based on completed years in apprenticeship program.

Application: Kick start your future, today! If this sounds like you, check out our website (www.outdooraspects.com), email us and let us know why you think you'd be a great fit for our team!

Work remotely

  • No

title: Gardener/Labourer
description:
Certified horticulturalist looking for a reliable and responsible gardener to join our team. Must be able to lift 50lbs and do a physically demanding job. Our small business does ongoing maintenance (lawn cutting, pruning, weeding) for our clients as well as new garden installations, planting, small paving jobs and more.

We work Monday to Friday with the occasional Saturday during peak season of spring and fall.

Experience in commercial horticulture/landscaping is preferred. Starting wage can be discussed based on experience and wage increases dependant on performance. Most hires get a raise in the first month.

We need someone reliable and punctual who is on time for work every day and able to follow direction and learn as they go. Work days start at the plaza on Esquimalt road and successful candidates must be able to arrive there by 6:45am.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $20.00-$25.00 per hour

Additional pay:

title: Landscape Labourer
description:
Outdoor Aspects Landscaping Ltd.

Landscape Construction Technician
Who we are:
Outdoor Aspects Landscaping is a well established landscape company located in Vernon, BC serving the North Okanagan for the past 14 years. We are a landscape design and build firm founded on strong values that delivers creative, quality landscapes for our customers to enjoy for a lifetime while giving them an awesome customer experience to boot. Our team members take great pride in what we do. Our Landscape Construction Technicians play a major role in fulfilling the company’s vision. Their role is to work as a team with there crew leader ensuring projects are completed to specifications. Our company’s long standing reputation of high quality work and outstanding customer service depends on the skill and professionalism of our entire team.

Who you are:

This role is ideal for a person with a very high level of physical strength and stamina who enjoys physical labour. Any landscape construction experience installing paving stone patios, retaining walls, softscapes, irrigation systems, pools or working other physically demanding jobs would be a major asset. To be a good fit for this role, you will need to be able to commit to year round employment doing 10hr days 5 days a week from March to December and reduced hours and holiday time over the winter months. Winter work usually entails hardscape work that can be done as the weather allows. Priority will be given to applicants who have work experience in landscape construction. This position is available immediately.

What you’ll do:

1) Planting trees, shrubs and plants, installing drip lines and fabric

2) Shoveling and hand raking of soil, gravel, mulch and sand, laying sod

3) Assist in build irrigation systems, paving stone patios, retaining walls and fiberglass pools

4) Use landscaping equipment such as tampers, power wheel barrows, and mini skidsteers

What you’ll need:

1) Prior job experience in Landscape Construction is preferred

2) High level of physical fitness & stamina (ability to lift 80lbs consistently)

3) Ability to work outdoors in a wide variety of physical conditions

4) Ability to follow verbal directions and complete tasks without supervision

5) Your own transportation and driver license

6) A friendly and polite personality

7) A strong desire to learn and grow in the Landscape Industry

What you’ll get:

1) Red Seal Landscape Horticulturalist Journeyman apprenticeships available after completion of three months service if so desired.

2) Family friendly environment

3) Regular performance reviews

4) 4% vacation pay, overtime pay, 5 unpaid vacation days/yr (March-December) besides stat holidays

5) Medical and dental benefits package

6) Opportunity for advancement

7) A base starting wage of $17-23/hr pending level of experience plus additional compensation of up to $7/hr added based on completed years in apprenticeship program.

8) Free Tanning and Workouts.

If this sounds like you, check out our website (www.outdooraspects.com), email us and let us know why you think you'd be a great fit for our team! Kick start your future, today!

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent, Apprenticeship

title: Horticulturalist
description:
Summary

The Supervisor contributes to the success of a store by communicating the retail objectives of their respective department to the team. This role is responsible for assisting the Department Manager in managing and leading the department in providing high quality workmanship and service that ensures customer satisfaction. He/she assists the Department Manager and the team in consistently meeting performance expectations in terms of customer experience, sales growth, retail execution, and profitability.

Responsibilities and Tasks

Customer Service

  • Encourages and maintains a culture that values an excellent customer experience through effective training, supervision, and coaching.
  • Leads by example and consistently delivers an excellent customer experience.
  • Holds team members accountable for providing an excellent customer experience and recognizes those who excel in it.
  • Works as a team with other departments to provide an excellent customer experience.
  • Suggests value-added and related products to customers to ensure they go home with all they need.
  • Closes the discussion with the customer by using a closing statement (e.g., “Is there anything else I can do for you today?” “Thank you for shopping at Canadian Tire.”).
  • Responds to and handles customer inquiries, requests, and concerns in a timely manner, over the phone and in person.
  • Handles multiple customers in an effective and efficient manner.

Operations

  • Assists the Department Manager in maintaining quality department presentation, through daily inspections and ensuring all store audit performance requirements are met in the department (e.g., number of holes, labels, top shelf storage, rain check posted for out of stock items, deadlines of seasonal changeovers, cleanliness, facing, fixtures are stored away when not in use, etc.).
  • Supervises and assists team members in daily departmental operations in order to meet established productivity goals.
  • Assists the Department Manager in following up on work and projects on the floor in order to measure progress and address issues immediately, while being visible and available for team members and customers.
  • Walks the department to understand what needs to be accomplished on a daily basis.
  • Maintains department inventory and fullness through accurate stock levels and bin caps.
  • Plays an active role in the department team by openly sharing opinions and ideas on how to improve department success, and by participating in meetings and all training as required.
  • Informs team on in-store promotions, in-store deals, and new product locations.
  • Assists with planning and managing daily/weekly departmental activities as well as seasonal changeovers, and works with the team to execute them.
  • Provides support to cashiers and customer service representatives for cash pickups, cash closing, warranties, returns, guarantees, etc.
  • Assists in the orientation and training of new employees, store opening and closing responsibilities.
  • Assists in organizing and conducting regular department team meetings.
  • Communicates and ensures compliance of all company, store, and department policies, as well as, health and safety programs and regulations.
  • Uses professional language and maintains a professional appearance (uniform, hygiene, grooming, and name tag) when interacting with others.
  • Assists the Department Manager with various projects and tasks.
  • Completes other tasks, as required.

Requirements

  • Experience in retail sales, execution, and operations.
  • Good working knowledge of department products and functions.
  • Demonstrated supervisory, leadership, and/or managerial experience, or relevant experience.
  • Ability to operate cash register is an asset.
  • Basic math and keyboarding skills.
  • Experience in a Canadian Tire store is considered an asset.

Required Skills and Abilities

Successful candidates will demonstrate the following competencies:

  • Highly approachable, customer-oriented individual who thrives on offering exceptional service to customers.
  • Strong belief in the Canadian Tire Values of honesty, integrity, and respect.
  • Effective written and oral communication skills (e.g., probing, listening, etc.) and the ability to maintain professional communication, even in challenging situations.
  • Ability to complete retail tasks according to instructions and to demonstrate responsibility for outcomes.
  • Ability to assist in leading and managing others to achieve common goals in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to motivate and coach others.
  • Ability to resolve retail and/or customer issues.
  • Ability to adapt and cope with challenging and changing situations.
  • Ability to find solutions to problems and make decisions.
  • Positive attitude, punctuality, and solid work ethic.

Potential Career Opportunities

  • Next levels: Department Manager and Store Manager.
  • Other retail, customer service and management opportunities in a large network of more than 485 Canadian Tire Stores across the country.
  • Career opportunities across the larger Canadian Tire family (Canadian Tire Petroleum, PartSource, Mark’s, FGL Sports Ltd, Canadian Tire Corporation Limited, and Canadian Tire Financial Services).

Physical Demands and Working Conditions

In compliance with the store’s Health and Safety Policies and Procedures:

  • Standing/walking for 8 hours.
  • Lifting and/or carrying of merchandise items, as required, on a regular, frequent and unassisted basis. Merchandise items may vary in weight from “light” to “heavy”.
  • Lifting and turning repeatedly throughout the shift.
  • Lifting above the shoulder, from floor to shoulder and floor to waist.
  • Walking and carrying at the same time and pushing/pulling as required.
  • Twisting, turning, reaching and working above shoulder level.
Show more

title: Licensed Gardener
description:
Position:           Licensed/Certified Gardener

                               Pine Ridge Memorial Gardens

 

Date:               April 26, 2022

 

Our Pine Ridge Memorial Gardens location, located at 541 Taunton Road W., Ajax, Ontario is currently recruiting a Seasonal Licensed/Certified Gardener from April until the end of October.

 

The successful candidate for this position strives to keep pace with the ever-changing service demands and is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of our customers in a sensitive and professional manner.

 

This position is based on a 40 hour work week, and may change as required for the needs of the business, including working of overtime when required.

 

The successful candidate will be responsible for:

  • Design and prepare annual/perennial beds for planting.
  • Plant and maintain annual flower beds.
  • Divide, transplant and maintain perennial planting areas.
  • Cultivate, edge, and water flower beds, trees and shrubs; remove weeds and dead plant material.
  • Clip, prune and shape trees, bushes and hedges as required.
  • Bring any insect infestation to the attention of the supervisor.
  • Acts as a lead in providing training and guidance, and to supervise the gardening staff.

·        Perform other duties as required.

 

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities required for this role:

  • Post-secondary education with certificate or diploma in Horticulture.
  • Training certification and/or extensive previous horticulture experience.
  • Experience supervising staff.
  • Integrated Pest Management (IPM) training
  • A valid driver’s license is a mandatory requirement for this position.
  • Ability to lift and carry 50lbs.
  • Ability to work in an outdoor environment.
  • Ability to multi-task, meet deadlines and be able to work independently as well as in a team-oriented environment.
  • Proven leadership abilities
  • Excellent attention to detail and consistently high level of accuracy.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Demonstrated strong customer service skills with the ability to partner will all levels of the organization.
  • Exemplifies Arbor’s values of integrity, trust, teamwork and excellence.

 

 

If you are interested in applying for this position please email your resume and cover letter no later than March 18, 2022 to:

 

Corey Cormier, Property Manager

Email: ccormier@arbormemorial.com

title: Tradesperson - Landscape Horticulturist (Make a Future)
description:
Spread across one of the largest and fastest-growing cities in British Columbia, Surrey Schools, recipient of BC's Top Employer and Canada's Greenest Employer awards, is the city's second largest employer. Located on Canada's spectacular West Coast and nestled in the southwest corner of Green Timbers Urban Forest, we are just 30 minutes southeast of the city of Vancouver. Surrey Schools is the largest and fastest growing public school district in BC, and with 140 sites across 328km2. The Surrey Schools District team of approximately 12,000 employees works tirelessly every day to ensure that children are getting the best start they can, providing the preparation to be our leaders of tomorrow.

Due to growth, Surrey Schools seeks to fill a new position in the Grounds Landscape Department. Reporting to the Grounds Landscape Foreperson and Manager of Grounds, this position will be responsible for providing exceptional technical support to ensure maintenance programs and projects adhere to applicable codes, by-laws & regulations. Your considerable knowledge of the methods, practices, materials, tools and equipment used in horticultural work along with extensive knowledge of plant materials, fertilizers, integrated pest management, landscaping methods and design will make you an asset to the team. Leadership skills and training will be essential as you assist employees engaged in the maintenance and development of school grounds. This position communicates between internal and external consultants/contractors/suppliers to ensure the successful completion of assigned projects and as such the ideal candidate must have exceptional communication skills both written and verbal. Success in this position requires excellent organizational skills and the ability to meet multiple and competing deadlines, as well as responding to time-oriented emergencies. The Horticulturist role requires thorough knowledge of computer applications and software applications related to the role.

Surrey Schools prides itself on providing our facilities staff with excellent work-life balance. This days-only position offers a shift of 7am-3pm, Monday to Friday. The successful applicant will be based out of the beautiful District Facilities Centre located in the heart of Surrey.

Applicants Must Have
  • A 2-year technical Diploma in Horticulture from a recognized college/institution or a Horticulture Trades Qualification Certificate.
  • A valid unrestricted Class 5 BC Driver’s license.
  • Supervisory Skills.
  • Must be physically able to perform heavy manual work.
This is a unionized position that offers a 37.5 hour work week with an hourly wage rate of $34.46, plus a liberal benefit package including Municipal Pension, health, vacation and sick benefits. Effective date of benefits will be per collective agreement.

Interested and qualified applicants should apply on Make a Future at https://bit.ly/38hcTm4 by 4:00 pm, Monday April 22, 2022.

Note: The successful applicant is required to consent to a Criminal Record Search prior to employment. Only applicants selected for interviews are contacted.

Value

title: Horticulturist
description:
Paul Sangha Creative is looking for a full-time, experiencedHorticulturistto join our dynamic team.The Firm specializes in high quality landscape designs with special attention to detail, service and quality.

Recommended Skill Set

– A degree, diploma or certificate in horticulture, landscape architecture, or related field

– Experience working in the field of horticulture

– Exceptional design skills with a portfolio of previous work

– Knowledge of, and experience designing with, drought-tolerant hardy plant species

– Design adaptability in working locally and abroad, forging relationships and gathering information

– A passionate plants person with knowledge of local nurseries, suppliers and plants

– Ability to read architectural drawings

– Hand drawing and computer drafting skills

– Knowledge of Microsoft office

– Keen interest in learning and exploring new ideas

– Strong communication skills

– A professional team player that is focused, well organized, enjoys feedback, detail oriented, and works well under pressure to meet deadlines

– Driver’s license

Additional Assets Include

– Knowledge of Mac computers, Vectorworks for CAD, SketchUp and Adobe CS

– Horticultural knowledge or experience applicable to other regions and climates

– Knowledge of resilient and regenerative soil, agricultural and landscape/plant maintenance practices

This position includes but is not limited to the following duties:

– Sourcing trees and plants

– Site visits for tree and plant placement

– Design and implementation of detailed planting plans

– Client liaison and work with growers, nurseries, suppliers and contractors

– Identification concerns in existing gardens (i.e. Pests/disease)

– Reviewing maintenance, plant health and providing constructive feedback for clients and landscapers

– Introduction of new and exciting ideas and plants into each design

– Site visits for tree and plant placement

If you are interested in joining our team, please email a cover letter and a resumé for consideration to info@paulsangha.com. We value your interest, however only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

Paul Sangha Creative

125 East 4th Avenue

Vancouver, BC V5T 1G4

Canada

Riva

info@paulsangha.com

title: Gardener (Pacific National Exhibition)
description:
Job Description

Part-Time; Casual (April - August/September)

Wage: $28.52/hour

Date Posted: April 7, 2022

Who We Are…

The Pacific National Exhibition is an iconic institution in BC, famous for bringing generations of people together to celebrate and build memories. This 111-year old, non-profit organization has an annual operating budget of approximately $58 million dollars and generates revenue through four activity streams: the 15 day annual summer Fair which averages 800,000 guests each year, Playland amusement park which welcomes 375,000 guests annually including Fright Nights, year-round events including concerts, trade shows and film, cultural and community events. The fourth activity stream is park care and facility maintenance. The PNE is proud of the work it does at Hastings Park and has a vibrant team that is passionate about events, guest experience and being the best we can be.

At the PNE, we strive to create an environment that reflects our organization’s core values: Enthusiasm, Excellence and Evolution. With a focus on these core values, we are committed to achieving our mission which is to “Deliver Memorable Experiences” for all who interact with the PNE whether it is our guests, our employees, or the community.

We are looking for hardworking and passionate individuals in part-time and full-time capacities to ensure that our grounds are maintained and kept to a high standard for our guests and community. The Gardener of the PNE Tech Services Department will work under the direction of the Manager, Tech Services and garden, manage and cultivate various plants, flowers and shrubs that are on the PNE site.

Why join our Team?
  • Exhilarating and fun-loving culture
  • Flexible work environment
  • Opportunity for free or discounted tickets to shows, events, sports games, and much more
  • Staff discounts for Playland, The Fair, and Fright Nights, as well as all PNE Food Stands
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Opportunity to create lasting memories and friendships!
What will you do this year?

In your role as a Gardener, your primary accountabilities will be to:
  • Responsible for taking care of the various plants, flowers, and shrubs that are present on the grounds
  • Plant, cultivate, fertilize, and prune numerous varieties of plants, flowers, shrubs, bushes, and trees
  • Assign and supervise the work of one or more Gardener’s Helpers engaged in routine gardening tasks
  • Ensure projects are completed within specified time and notify supervisor if difficulties arise, while accurately completing timesheets and documentation of work
  • Operate and maintain gardening equipment and tools
  • Maintain a safe and clean work environment
  • Maintain clean hygiene and following company COVID protocols
  • Perform other related duties as assigned
What else?
  • Must have a valid class 5 BC Driver’s License
  • Currently enrolled or have training/certification from a recognized horticultural, arboriculture and/or landscaping programs; or an equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Min. of 3+ years of gardening experience is preferred
  • Proven knowledge of planting, cultivating and care of a wide variety of plants, shrubs, trees and flowers; of methods, materials, tools and practices
  • Ability to perform continuous strenuous activity and able to work in physically awkward positions
  • Capable of working at heights and lifting heavy materials up to WCB restrictions
  • Possess knowledge of the hazards and proper safety precautions of the construction trades
  • Ability to communicate with the public and answer gardening related questions as required
  • Comfortable working in all weather conditions: rain, snow, and sun
  • Possession of the following certification is considered an asset: Certification in use of Aerial Work Platforms and Counterbalance Forklifts, Tree Risk Assessment Qualification (TRAQ), Pesticide Applicator Certificate, completion of a recognized chainsaw safety course
  • Candidates must undergo a Criminal Record Check
Who are you?
  • Passionate
  • Horticulturist
  • Team player
  • Detail-oriented
Where and when to APPLY?

Applications can be submitted via the PNE website at www.pne.ca/jobs and will be accepted until the role is filled.

We look forward to hearing from you!

The PNE is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, committed to creating an inclusive workforce that reflects the diverse community we proudly serve. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, national or ethnic origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or age. If you require any support or accommodations throughout any stage of the recruitment process, please contact the People & Culture Department at hr@pne.ca.

title: Gardener
description:
Job Description

Part-Time; Casual (April - August/September)

Wage: $28.52/hour

Date Posted: April 7, 2022

Who We Are…

The Pacific National Exhibition is an iconic institution in BC, famous for bringing generations of people together to celebrate and build memories. This 111-year old, non-profit organization has an annual operating budget of approximately $58 million dollars and generates revenue through four activity streams: the 15 day annual summer Fair which averages 800,000 guests each year, Playland amusement park which welcomes 375,000 guests annually including Fright Nights, year-round events including concerts, trade shows and film, cultural and community events. The fourth activity stream is park care and facility maintenance. The PNE is proud of the work it does at Hastings Park and has a vibrant team that is passionate about events, guest experience and being the best we can be.

At the PNE, we strive to create an environment that reflects our organization’s core values: Enthusiasm, Excellence and Evolution. With a focus on these core values, we are committed to achieving our mission which is to “Deliver Memorable Experiences” for all who interact with the PNE whether it is our guests, our employees, or the community.

We are looking for hardworking and passionate individuals in part-time and full-time capacities to ensure that our grounds are maintained and kept to a high standard for our guests and community. The Gardener of the PNE Tech Services Department will work under the direction of the Manager, Tech Services and garden, manage and cultivate various plants, flowers and shrubs that are on the PNE site.

Why join our Team?
  • Exhilarating and fun-loving culture
  • Flexible work environment
  • Opportunity for free or discounted tickets to shows, events, sports games, and much more
  • Staff discounts for Playland, The Fair, and Fright Nights, as well as all PNE Food Stands
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Opportunity to create lasting memories and friendships!
What will you do this year?

In your role as a Gardener, your primary accountabilities will be to:
  • Responsible for taking care of the various plants, flowers, and shrubs that are present on the grounds
  • Plant, cultivate, fertilize, and prune numerous varieties of plants, flowers, shrubs, bushes, and trees
  • Assign and supervise the work of one or more Gardener’s Helpers engaged in routine gardening tasks
  • Ensure projects are completed within specified time and notify supervisor if difficulties arise, while accurately completing timesheets and documentation of work
  • Operate and maintain gardening equipment and tools
  • Maintain a safe and clean work environment
  • Maintain clean hygiene and following company COVID protocols
  • Perform other related duties as assigned
What else?
  • Must have a valid class 5 BC Driver’s License
  • Currently enrolled or have training/certification from a recognized horticultural, arboriculture and/or landscaping programs; or an equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Min. of 3+ years of gardening experience is preferred
  • Proven knowledge of planting, cultivating and care of a wide variety of plants, shrubs, trees and flowers; of methods, materials, tools and practices
  • Ability to perform continuous strenuous activity and able to work in physically awkward positions
  • Capable of working at heights and lifting heavy materials up to WCB restrictions
  • Possess knowledge of the hazards and proper safety precautions of the construction trades
  • Ability to communicate with the public and answer gardening related questions as required
  • Comfortable working in all weather conditions: rain, snow, and sun
  • Possession of the following certification is considered an asset: Certification in use of Aerial Work Platforms and Counterbalance Forklifts, Tree Risk Assessment Qualification (TRAQ), Pesticide Applicator Certificate, completion of a recognized chainsaw safety course
  • Candidates must undergo a Criminal Record Check
Who are you?
  • Passionate
  • Horticulturist
  • Team player
  • Detail-oriented
Where and when to APPLY?

Applications can be submitted via the PNE website at www.pne.ca/jobs and will be accepted until the role is filled.

We look forward to hearing from you!

The PNE is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, committed to creating an inclusive workforce that reflects the diverse community we proudly serve. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, national or ethnic origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or age. If you require any support or accommodations throughout any stage of the recruitment process, please contact the People & Culture Department at hr@pne.ca.

title: Lead Hand Gardener
description:
You'll showcase the natural beauty of the environment in which our guests visit! With your attention to detail and leadership kills, you will care and maintain ornamental plants, shrubs and trees on the hotel grounds and selected golf course sites.

Covid-19 Safety Policy

In order to keep our employees and the general public safe from the threat of Covid 19 and the rise of variants in the community, the Hotel has implemented a Covid-19 Safety Policy.

What Is In It For You
  • Employee accommodation available
  • Full time employees will be eligible to join the benefit plan which includes extended medical through Canada Life (Health, Dental, Life Insurance, Short Term Disability)
  • Full time employees will also be eligible to participate in Fairmont Pension Plan, which includes matched employee contributions
  • Employee benefit card offering discounted rates in Accor worldwide
  • Learning programs through our Academies
  • Opportunity to develop your talent and grow within your property and across the world
  • Ability to make a difference through our Corporate Social Responsibility activities, like Planet 21
What You Will Be Doing
  • Oversee daily operations of the Gardening Department
  • Consistently offer a professional and friendly greeting, and provide engaging service
  • Grooming and tending gardens, and ensuring a high level of aesthetic quality throughout the hotel property
  • Operates mechanical and power equipment utilized in the maintenance of ornamental plants and trees
  • Other duties as assigned
Your Experience And Skills Include
  • Knowledge of the characteristics and cultural requirements of ornamental plants, shrubs and trees adapted to the region is an asset
  • Must have knowledge and experience or skills in basic gardening or other horticulture related areas
  • A valid BC Driver’s license with a clean record is required
Physical Aspects Include But Are Not Limited To
  • Constant standing and walking throughout shift
  • Frequent lifting and carrying up to 50 lbs
  • Frequent kneeling, pushing, pulling, lifting
  • Occasional ascending or descending ladders, stairs and ramps
Your Team And Working Environment

Nestled at the base of Blackcomb Mountain, Fairmont Chateau Whistler resort defines mountain luxury in the heart of Whistler, British Columbia - Host Mountain Resort of the 2010 Winter Olympics. Located in the spectacular coastal mountain range, Whistler is Canada’s premier, year-round outdoor adventure destination - just two hours north of downtown Vancouver. Offering ski-in, ski-out convenience and on-site championship golf course, Fairmont Chateau Whistler is Whistler’s largest conference resort hotel with 519 guestrooms and suites, exceptional dining in five unique outlets and full resort amenities including a slopeside Health Club. Since opening its doors in 1989, this landmark destination has welcomed guests and colleagues to an unforgettable mountain adventure- start yours today!

Must be legally eligible to work in Canada. The hotel is unable to assist candidates in obtaining Canadian work authorization.

Our Commitment To Diversity & Inclusion

We are an inclusive company and our ambition is to attract, recruit and promote diverse talent.

Why work for Accor?

We are far more than a worldwide leader. We welcome you as you are and you can find a job and brand that matches your personality. We support you to grow and learn every day, making sure that work brings purpose to your life, so that during your journey with us, you can continue to explore Accor’s limitless possibilities.

By joining Accor, every chapter of your story is yours to write and together we can imagine tomorrow's hospitality. Discover the life that awaits you at Accor, visit https://careers.accor.com/

Do what you love, care for the world, dare to challenge the status quo! #BELIMITLESS

title: Landscape Foreman/woman
description:
JIM’S MOWING – WALNUT GROVE

LAWN MOWING – LANDSCAPING – GARDENING – FERTILIZING – AERATION – YARD CLEANUP – GENERAL LABOUR

Searching for team based individual who enjoys working outdoors on basic lawn care and maintenance sites. Seeking foreman that demonstrates high level of professionalism and motivation. Being reliable and committed is a must.

- Regular mow routes

-Yard clean ups

-Lawn care

PREVIOUS EXPERIENCE IS REQUIRED. Looking for an individual that will be a foreman and run own routes. Fully responsible to complete a schedule of properites. Company vehicle is inlcuded. All training, uniforms and WCB coverage will be included.

Compensation will be based off experience. Pay raises, bonuses and incentives are based off performance.

Availability Monday - Friday and occasional weekends if you like to make extra.

8 hour shifts plus overtime available

Service work areas cover all of langley.

- landscaping experience (Mowing, blowing, edging.)

- Must have clean drivers license

-Must be able to tow trailer

- Must be able to use ride on mower.

-Must be able to use power equipment such as push mower, ride on mower (zero turn), edger and blower

** company vehicle will be included**must be able to pick up truck and trailer in walnut grove and return to location at days end. All equipment and expenses paid for**

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $30.00-$35.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Company car

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Langley, BC: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:

  • Landscape maintenance: 1 year (preferred)
  • Landscaping Supervisors: 1 year (preferred)

title: Gardener 1
description:
Recruitment Details

The City of Winnipeg is a vibrant and dynamic organization with many opportunities!

We offer a diverse and welcoming work environment that delivers quality services to our citizens.

Gardener 1 (Seasonal & Temporary)

Public Works Department

Posting No: 121058

Closing Date: May 17, 2022

 Job Profile

Job Profile

Under the supervision of a Foreman 3 or designate, the Gardener 1 will perform skilled work in the care of perennials, bedding plants, shrubs and landscaped areas. Maintenance tasks include weeding, watering, spraying, cultivating, staking, pruning, preparing planting beds with hand tools and power tools, integrating soil amendments, planting flower beds, planters, planning, etc. In the course of carrying out daily tasks, the Gardener 1 practices established safety procedures in the execution of assigned duties and ensures public safety.

As The Gardener 1 You Will
  • Perform responsible and skilled work in the care of perennials, bedding plants, shrubs, landscaped areas, etc., including weeding, watering, spraying, cultivating, staking, pruning, preparing planting beds with hand tools and power tools, arranges and plants the layout of flowerbeds and planters, etc.
  • Maintain a variety of records, i.e. designing of floral arrangements and calculating the amount of plant material required for sites designated to that gardener, keeps seasonal records of plant material, seasonal landscaping materials requirements.
  • Diagnose for pests and diseases, and perform application of fertilizers, insecticides, and fungicides under the supervision of a 2018 licenced Pesticide Applicator as required.
  • Operate a variety of equipment including hand tools and power tools in the performance of his/her duties.
  • Operate vehicles and equipment required for gardening maintenance operations including pickup trucks, utility vehicles such as gators, water pumps, etc.
  • Follow established safe work practices, operating policies and procedures and ensures compliance
  • Supervise junior employees as required and assigned.
  • Perform other related duties consistent with the classification as required.
Your Education And Qualifications Include
  • Senior 4 (Grade 12) education or GED (General Education Diploma. Grade 12 equivalent) supplemented by additional related horticulture training/courses or completion of post-secondary training in horticulture.
  • A valid 2022 Manitoba Pesticide Applicator's License (core plus landscape category) is preferred.
  • Successfully completed or be willing to obtain the following courses:
  • First Aid Certificate
  • WHMIS/GHS
  • Temporary Traffic Control
  • Demonstrated ability to understand, execute and communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to take and complete additional courses as required.
  • Demonstrated ability to establish and maintain positive working relationships with employees at all levels of the organization, external contacts and the public, in accordance with the Respectful Workplace Standard.
  • Ability to supervise, coach and mentor junior staff.
  • Demonstrated ability in the safe operation and maintenance of equipment, hand tools and power tools consistent with the classification which may include a review of operator training records and reports.
  • Thorough knowledge of the occupational hazards and safety precaution policies and regulations and the ability to adhere to and enforce safety rules and policies along with a satisfactory past safety record related to this position which may include a review of past safety violations and infractions.
Conditions Of Employment
  • The successful applicant(s) must maintain legal eligibility to work in Canada. If the successful applicant possesses a work permit, it is their responsibility to ensure the permit remains valid.
  • Prior to commencement of employment, the successful applicant will be required to provide proof of COVID-19 vaccination by providing a Government of Manitoba issued QR code and photo identification or providing proof of an exemption from the COVID-19 vaccination approved by the Government of Manitoba.
  • Must possess and maintain a valid Manitoba Class 5 Driver’s Licence.
  • Successful candidates will be required to provide a valid Driver’s Notice in Force letter.
  • The successful applicant(s) will be requried to provide personal protective safety boots at their own expense.
  • Ability to work outdoors in all weather conditions.
  • Ability to stand and walk for prolonged periods and over uneven terrain.
  • Must be physically capable of performing duties of the position. (e.g. capable of lifting and moving objects up to 30 lbs. (flower flats, tllers, on/off trucks, wheelbarrows).
  • Must be able to work various shifts, including evenings, weekends, and overtime at various locations as needed.
CORE COMPETENCIES for ALL EMPLOYEES OF THE CITY OF WINNIPEG:
  • Citizen & Customer Focus
  • Respecting Diversity
  • Ethics and Values
  • Integrity and Trust
  • Results Oriented
How To Apply

APPLY ONLINE, including all documentation listed below:
  • Current resume AND Application Form (Required).
  • Applications submitted without REQUIRED documentation will not be considered.
  • Your application documents must clearly indicate how you meet the qualifications of the position.*
    Notes

    Online applications can be submitted at http://www.winnipeg.ca/hr/ . For instructions on how to apply and how to attach required documents please refer to our FAQ's or contact 311. The City of Winnipeg uses the Korn Ferry Leadership Architect Competency Model as part of the recruitment process.

    Position Type: Seasonal & Temporary

    The salary range for this position is $20.10 - $24.45 hourly bi-weekly, as per the Gardener 1 classification within the C.U.P.E. Collective Agreement.
    • Applicants may be required to undergo testing to determine their knowledge, abilities and skills as they relate to the qualifications of the position.
    We have great benefits and competitive salaries, and we are committed to ongoing learning and career development!

    We value diversity in our workplace. Indigenous peoples, women, racialized peoples, persons with disabilities, 2SLGBTQ+ peoples and Newcomers are encouraged to self-declare.

    Only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. Requests for Reasonable Accommodation will be accepted during the hiring process.

title: Naturaliste
description:
Tu veux faire découvrir la forêt et ses richesses aux gens du Bas-Saint-Laurent ?

Nous recherchons un.e naturaliste passionné.e !


CE QUE TU FERAS

Animer des ateliers éducatifs forestiers pour les jeunes

Vulgariser des enjeux forestiers auprès du grand public

Élaborer et réaliser du nouveau matériel éducatif

Préparer des communications pour nos médias sociaux


CE QUE TU POSSÈDES                                                                  

Formation collégiale ou universitaire en foresterie biologie, écologie ou en sciences naturelles

Bonnes connaissances de l’écosystème forestier

Habiletés à communiquer, de l’entregent et de la débrouillardise

Connaissances de base de la suite Office

Permis de conduire valide et une voiture


CE QUE NOUS T'OFFRONS

Un environnement de travail au coeur du milieu forestier

Une équipe dynamique et ouverte aux idées innovantes !

Un horaire flexible de 35 h/semaines

Salaire à partir de 17,85 $/h

Remboursement des déplacements

2 semaines de congés / années

Jusqu'à 2 jours de congés sociaux par année


JOINS-TOI À L' ÉQUIPE !

Fais nous parvenir ton C.V. et ta lettre de motivation à : admin@afbl.info

Info : 418 723-3161 ou www.afbl.info

Entée en fonction : juin 2022

title: Gardener's Helper - On Call
description:
Physical Requirements

The position of Gardener’s Helper is physically demanding and requires the ability to sustain a high level of physical exertion, including walking, lifting, shoveling, crouching and climbing ladders. This position requires working outdoors in all weather, including extreme heat, cold, snow and rain.

Responsibilities
  • Care and maintenance of ornamental plants, shrubs and trees on the hotel grounds and shared spaces
  • Grooming and tending of lawns and gardens, including the roof-top herb garden, while ensuring a high aesthetic standard
  • Digging, shoveling and raking
  • Operating mechanical and power equipment
  • Actively participating in the Fairmont Empress’s environmental program and department specific initiatives towards sustainable operations
  • Safety conscious and actively involved in maintaining a safe work environment
  • Providing a high standard of internal and external customer service
  • Additional tasks as assigned by management
Qualifications
  • Recent experience in a gardening/landscaping role in a high-profile operation (experience in a hotel setting is an asset) or in a very physically demanding position
  • Reliable, dependable and a team player
  • Ability to work effectively with minimal supervision and think on your feet
  • Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills
  • Ability to work overtime as required
  • Comfortable working outdoors in all weather conditions
  • Must have a valid BC Driver’s license and steel toed boots
  • Horticulture/Landscaping education or working towards certification is an asset
  • Must pass a respirator fit test
  • Physical ability to perform the requirements of the job, including:
    • Standing/walking for extended periods of time, and walking long distances up to 20km a day
    • Performing repetitive work, including kneeling, bending, crouching and reaching
    • Frequent pushing, pulling, digging, and lifting/carrying up to 80lbs
    • Climbing ladders while carrying up to 40lbs
    • Ability to work outdoors in heat, cold, rain and snow

title: Gardener
description:
Job Description

Brandt is currently seeking a full-time seasonal Gardener. The Gardener position will be responsible for assisting in the care of flowers, shrubs and trees for residential and commercial landscaping job sites. Additional duties include weeding, hedge and shrub pruning and edging, maintaining garden areas (sweeping, leaf blowing), spring/fall cleanup, and other duties as assigned. This is a seasonal full time position available in the spring. The ideal candidate will be friendly, professional, able to work independently as well as on a team in all weather conditions, and possess in-depth knowledge of effective gardening techniques.

Required Experience
  • Prior gardening experience considered an asset.
  • The ability to remain on your feet for long periods of time.
  • A love of the outdoors and plant life.
  • Preference will be given to those candidates who have the ability to work some Saturdays.
skills: ['Prior gardening experience considered an asset.']

title: Gardener
description:
The Lake Joseph Club is Hiring!

The Horticulturalist/Gardener is responsible for the enhancement and quality of the landscaped areas at the ClubLink property. This position offers you the opportunity to work in a dynamic environment while being exposed to all facets of gardening.

Responsibilities
  • Aid in the design of new gardens.
  • Prune, fertilize, and apply other gardening techniques as required.
  • Advise, obtain quotes, and assist in the purchasing of horticultural tools, supplies, and materials.
  • Select the appropriate plants for new and existing gardens at the Club.
  • Spray plants to control pests and diseases.
  • Plant and maintain all gardens to the high standards of ClubLink.
  • Create and implement a five-year plan for on-course gardens and native areas.
  • Keep accurate records of tasks and duties performed.
Qualifications
  • Knowledge, understanding, and experience working in all areas of garden design and plants.
  • Diploma or certificate in horticulture or equivalent considered an asset.
  • A self-starter and able to work independently with minimal instructions.
  • Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
  • Have both excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • High regard for the health and safety of self and others.
This is a Seasonal Position.

ClubLink is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an inclusive workplace. Please contact jobs@clublink.ca if a workplace accommodation is needed throughout the selection process. Thank you for your interest in ClubLink.

title: Landscape Designer
description:
Apply Now

Landscape Designer

Company: Donohoe Living Landscapes

Location: Vancouver, BC, Canada

Donohoe Living Landscapes is seeking an experienced Landscape Designer to collaborate on the development of our custom residential designs. You will be contributing to a variety of projects throughout the province, and working directly with our clients, sub-contractors, and our team of designers.

For more than a decade, Donohoe Living Landscapes has been developing thoughtful, bespoke designs for single-family homes throughout British Columbia. Our founder Ryan Donohoe was educated at Inchbald, and we have received numerous awards including the 2021 Western Living Landscape Designer of the Year. From our downtown office in Vancouver we offer our team competitive wages, an extended benefits package, and encouragement and support to advance within your career. You will play a key role in the entire process of development in our growing company.

Job Description

Collaborate with our landscape architects and designers on concepts and working drawings, and hopefully lead the development of our landscape designs in the near future;

Work with our in-house horticulturalist to produce our stunning planting plans;

Join our project manager in ensuring the construction of our projects are properly executed;

Working directly with clients, contractors, and subcontractors to properly communicate design intent;

Contributing to our ‘Pro Bono’ projects, currently a Covid-19 memorial garden for a local extended care facility;

Collaborating with the team to create show gardens in the near future;

Bring your enthusiasm for landscape designs that push the boundary of what is expected.

Experience

3+ years working as a Landscape Designer with a focus on residential design;

A diploma or degree in Landscape Design or Landscape Architecture, Horticulture, Botany, or Garden Design;

Skilled understanding of Vectorworks and Adobe Design Suite;

Valid Class 5 Driver’s License.

Please see our new website at: www.donohoelivinglandscapes.com. Say hello and send relevant information to jessica@donohoelivinglandscapes.com. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Landscape Construction Foreman
description:
4.5 day workweek

$35-$40/hr all year

Leadership Training

Small and Personal


We're clear on enjoying a flourishing workplace and culture that invests in people and helps them thrive. Meaningful work and rich relationships are important to us! We'd love to get to know you more and see if we're a great fit for each other.


Role Purpose:

The Foreman is Valleywood’s point person ensuring that all work executed by the team is delivered the “Valleywood Way”. The “Valleywood Way” means that, leading with Valleywood purpose and values, the team is growing, clients are delighted by the on-site work, and the work is delivered on time and budget.


Role Summary:

The Foreman is responsible for the day-to-day operations of Valleywood’s on-site team by:

1. Being an ambassador:

a. Leading the team in such a way that they “want” to work for the Foreman.

b. Helping ensure client delight and cultivating a sense of partnership with suppliers and others connecting with the on-site team.

c. Ensuring vehicles, equipment, and the site, as influenced by a Valleywood Foreman, are representative of Valleywood values.

2. Delivering on the practical things that matter most for every job:

a. Safety

b. Quality

c. Efficiency

d. “We Are Winning” team metrics:

i. Team is growing in skill and knowledge

ii. Client delighted

iii. On time

iv. On Budget

3. Engaging, effective and frequent communication:

a. With their manager and with the onsite team.

b. Lead on-site team meetings that deliver passion, clarity and focus on the work to be done.

c. Keeping the client updated and informed

d. Ensuring that information flow between the site, office team and client occurs as agreed upon.

e. Able to communicate as required using IT tools and processes.

4. On-site Management:

a. Co-ordinating work flow

b. Material ordering and co-ordinating

c. Working with team “hands-on” production as needed

d. Equipment ordering and maintenance on site

Additional Requirements:

  • You hold a valid ‘G’ license
  • You are able to work in a heavy labour environment
